page.title: Uonukuhahake
page.category: Haʻapai
page.text: [[Image:Uonukuhahake.gif|right|350px|thumb|Uonukuhahake (motu)]] Ko '''Uonukuhahake''' ko e kiʻi motu ʻi he hahake ʻo [[:category:Haʻapai|Haʻapai]], ʻokú ne tuʻu ʻi he ''Hakau fakangataʻanga (Barrier reef)'' ʻi he tonga ʻo [[ʻUiha]], ofi ki [[Uonukuhihifo]]. {{Feituʻu Tonga|19°966|174°480}} {{potuʻi}} [[File:Uonukuhihifo, Uonukuhahake and part of Tofanga, Tonga.jpg|thumb|[[Uonukuhihifo]], Uonukuhahake mo [[Tofanga]].|left]] [[File:Uonukuhahake (cropped).jpg|thumb|Uonukuhahake.|left]] [[Category:Haʻapai]]

page.title: Uonukuhihifo
page.category: Haʻapai
page.text:
[[Image:Uonukuhihifo.gif|right|350px|thumb|Uonukuhihifo (motu)]] Ko '''Uonukuhihifo''' ko e kiʻi motu ʻi he hahake ʻo [[:category:Haʻapai|Haʻapai]], ʻokú ne tuʻu ʻi he ''Hakau fakangataʻanga (Barrier reef)'' ʻi he tonga ʻo [[ʻUiha]], ofi ki [[Uonukuhahake]]. {{Feituʻu Tonga|19°969|174°495}}. {{potuʻi}} [[File:Uonukuhihifo, Uonukuhahake and part of Tofanga, Tonga.jpg|thumb|Uonukuhihifo, Uonukuhahake mo Tofanga.|left]]
[[Category:Haʻapai]]

page.title: Ofolanga
page.category: Haʻapai
page.text:
[[Image:Ofolanga.gif|right|350px|thumb|Ofolanga (motu)]] Ko '''Ofolanga''' ko e motu tokelau taha ʻo [[:category:Haʻapai|Haʻapai]]. Ko ʻene fuo ʻoku meimei tatau he tapatolu, ko e ngaahi hingoa ʻo e muifonua ʻe 3: ko ''Maʻanahe'' (hihifo), ''Uiuekui'' (tonga) mo ''Faihava'' (tokelau).
ʻOku ʻikai nofo ʻa e kakai, kae ʻoku lahi honau ʻapi ʻuta ʻi ai.
Ko e tofiʻa ia ʻo e puleʻanga ʻo Tonga. {{Feituʻu Tonga|19°600|174°450}} {{potuʻi}} [[Category:Haʻapai]]

page.title: Moʻungaʻone
page.category: Haʻapai
page.text:
[[Image:Moʻungaʻone.gif|right|350px|thumb|Moʻungaʻone (motu)]] Ko '''Moʻungaʻone''' ko e motu ʻi he tokelau ʻo [[:category:Haʻapai|Haʻapai]].
ʻOku tuʻu ʻi ai ʻi he matātahi hahake ʻa e kolo, ko '''Moʻungaʻone (kolo)''', 19.640° S 174.481° W.
Ko e tofiʻa ia ʻo e puleʻanga ʻo Tonga, pea ʻoku ne kau ki he vahenga [[Haʻano|Kauvai Haʻano]]. Ko hono lahi ko e km² ʻe 1.17, ko e lahi ʻo e kakai naʻe tō ia mei he toko185 ʻi 1996 ki he toko136 ʻi 2006.<ref>[http://www.geohive.com/cntry/tonga.aspx GeoHive: Tonga]</ref>
==Tataku== <references/>
{{Feituʻu Tonga|19°637|174°484}} [[Category:Haʻapai]]

page.title: Luangahu
page.category: Haʻapai

page.title: ʻEiki fakanofo
page.category: Fetuʻutakiʻanga
page.text:
Kapau ʻoku ʻikai ʻi ai ʻa e toto fakaʻeiki maʻa e tokotaha, ʻe lava ia ʻo hoko ʻa e tuʻunga fakaʻeiki ʻosi hano fakanofo mo e hingoa fakaʻeiki pe fakanōpele. Kae hono māʻolunga, ʻa ia ko e '''ʻeiki fakanofo''', ʻoku toe siʻisiʻi ange ʻi he ʻeiki fakatoto, neongo heʻene maʻu mafai (pule). ʻOsi ʻene pongipongi, te ne ngāueʻaki ʻa e hingoa fakaʻeiki pē.
Ko e tuʻunga fakaʻeiki pehē ʻoku kau ki hoto hingoa pē, ʻoku lava huʻihuʻi ʻe he tokotaha, pea naʻe tupu mei heʻete tamai (ʻeiki): ''ko e tangata ko e fakahokohoko hingoa''.
ʻOku meimei tatau mo e kahoa kakala, ʻe lava huʻihuʻia. ʻA ia ʻi he lea fakaheliaki ko e ''kakala'' ʻoku ngāueʻaki maʻa e hingoa.
Vakai foki ki he [[Sino ʻi ʻeiki]].
==Tataku== *E. Bott; Power and rank in the kingdom of Tonga, 1981; Journal of the Polynesian Society '''90(1)''', 10-11, 38 {{English|translation}} [[Category:Fetuʻutakiʻanga]]

page.title: ʻEiki fakanofo/en
page.text:
When, in traditional Tongan society, someone has no noble blood, he still can become a chief by being installed with a title (''ʻeiki fakanofo''; from then on he proudly will use this title as his personal name). But such a chief remains in rank the lesser of those chiefs born by blood, even though he may have the wordly power over them.
In addition a title given, can become a title taken away. These titles are inherited through the father: ''the name flows forth from the man''.
In poetical Tongan language the term ''kakala'' (sweet smelling flower, as used in neck garlands) can be used for such noble titles, as you merely wear them and they can be taken away at any time.
Compare with [[Sino ʻi ʻeiki/en]]. {{Foki||ʻEiki fakanofo}}

page.title: Sino ʻi ʻeiki/en
Sino ʻi ʻeiki
page.category: Fetuʻutakiʻanga
page.text:
Kapau ʻoku ʻi ai a ʻa e tokotaha hano tuʻunga fakaʻeiki māʻolunga ʻaupito koeʻuhi he ''toto'', fakatātā ko e tama ia ʻo ha [[:category:Tuʻi Tonga Fefine|Tuʻi Tonga Fefine]] pe [[:category:Tamahā|Tamahā]] ʻi onoʻaho, ʻoku ui ko e '''sino ʻi ʻeiki'''. Ko e meʻa siʻisiʻi pē maʻana ko e fakanofo mo e hingoa fakaʻeiki pe fakanōpele, mahalo pē ʻoku ʻikai te ne fiemaʻu ia, mahalo pē naʻa ne ʻoatu ʻa e hingoa ki hano tehina. Kapau kuo maʻu ia, mahalo pē ʻe ʻikai te ne ngāueʻaki ʻa e hingoa fakaʻeiki.
Ko e tuʻunga fakaʻeiki pehē ʻoku kau ki hoto sino, ʻoku ʻikai lava huʻihuʻi ʻe he tokotaha, pea naʻe tupu mei heʻete faʻē (fehuhu): ''ko e fefine ko e fakahokohoko toto'', pe: ''tama tuʻu he faʻē''.
Vakai foki ki he [[ʻEiki fakanofo]].
==Tataku== *E. Bott; Power and rank in the kingdom of Tonga, 1981; Journal of the Polynesian Society '''90(1)''', 10-11, 38 *Collocott, 1922 {{English|translation}} [[Category:Fetuʻutakiʻanga]]

page.title: ʻIloaʻilangikapu
Sanualio Laufilitonga/en
page.text:
'''Sanualio Laufilitonga''' was the last [[:category:Tuʻi Tonga|Tuʻi Tonga]] to be. [[Tokiukamea|William Mariner]] saw him in Vavaʻu shortly before his departure in 1810 as a lively boy of about 15 years old.
He was maried with at least 18 wives. Only the most important are given in the diagram, the rest being second wives, like [[Moʻungaʻulufeholoi]].
[[Sālote Lupepauʻu]] was his favourite, but she did not produce children for him, and at the end she was confiscated by his most bitter opponent, [[Siaosi Tupou I|Tāufaʻāhau]]. [[Luseane Halaevalu Mataʻaho]], the daughter of a [[:Category:Tuʻi Kanokupolu|Tuʻi Kanokupolu]] and therefore the ''[[moheofo]]'', should have been his primary wife. But again Tāufaʻāhau played a trick on him, as she was no longer a virgin when she came to him, and as such was officially worthless. Yet her child would carry forth his succession line, the [[:category:Kalaniuvalu|Kalaniuvalu]] when established by [[Siaosi Tupou I]].
But the power which had been associated with the Tuʻi Tonga was on Laufilitonga's wish after his death diverted to his nephew [[Siaosi Fatafehi Toutaitokotaha]] (the [[:category:Tuʻipelehake|Tuʻipelehake]], grandson of his mother [[Tupou Veiongo]] through another man). {{Foki||Sanualio Laufilitonga}}

page.title: Luseane Halaevalu Mataʻaho/en
page.text: Luseane Halaevalu Mataʻaho, as daughter of a [[:Category:Tuʻi Kanokupolu|Tuʻi Kanokupolu]], was destined to become a ''[[moheofo]]'', the principal wife of the [[:Category:Tuʻi Tonga|Tuʻi Tonga]]. But her brother [[Siaosi Tupou I|Tāufaʻāhau]] was the enemy of [[Sanualio Laufilitonga]], and he worked out a trick to deprive the latter of an heir. He sent his sister first away to become a wife of the current [[:Category:Tuʻihaʻateiho|Tuʻihaʻateiho]], and only after she had given birth to a child was she sent to the Tuʻi Tonga. But then no longer a virgin, she was not acceptable any more. {{Foki||Luseane Halaevalu Mataʻaho}}

page.title: Lekaumoana
Lekaumoana/en
page.text: [[Fisilaumāli]] was an estate holder in the area of [[Pelehake]], but a chief of very low rank, if a chief at all. [[Mataelehaʻamea]], the [[:category:Tuʻi Kanokupolu|Tuʻi Kanokupolu]], sent his daugher [[Fusipala]] to marry him. In this way Mataelehaʻamea got a grateful vassal, who could supply him with a lot of goods. And Fisilaumāli's offspring got a high rank, (not he himself, as Tongan custom dictates) The child, Lekaumoana, was the beginning of the [[:category:Tuʻipelehake|Tuʻipelehake]] line, which grew out later to a very high ranking title. The claim that the Tuʻipelehake originated with [[Talafale]] may have been an invention of that time to elevate the title even more. {{Foki||Lekaumoana}}

page.title: Fīnau ʻUlukālala I ʻi Maʻofanga/en
page.text:
His extra name, (Maʻofanga, an old variant of [[Maʻufanga]]), to distinguish him from other Fīnau ʻUlukālala, he got because of his burial at that place.
There was also a daughter, Lōfitu, who married a Fijian and started the Tuʻineau dysnasty.
In 1793 or around, Fīnau was deposed as governor of [[:Category:Vavaʻu|Vavaʻu]], in which he used to be called the [[:Category:Tuʻi Vavaʻu|Tuʻi Vavaʻu]], by [[Tupoumoheofo]], who herself was just deposed as [[:Category:Tuʻi Kanokupolu|Tuʻi Kanokupolu]] and had fled to Vavaʻu. There she was still a commanding lady. Instead she nominated [[Vuna]] (descendant of [[Vuna Tuʻiʻoetau]], who had been deposed at an earlier date by [[Fusipala]] in favour of the ʻUlukālala). The discoverer [[Alejandro Malaspina]] from [[Sepeni|Spain]], who arrived in [[Neiafu]] on 20 May 1793, described how he was received by governor Vuna in [[Pouono]].
Fīnau was very angry, but not strong enough to disobey. He associated himself with [[Tukuʻaho]] who still wanted to become Tuʻi Kanokupolu. The latter succeeded so in 1797, but then apparently forgot everything about removing Vuna. Now Fīnau was really angry, and he transferred the revenge to his son [[Fīnau ʻUlukālala II ʻi Feletoa (Fangupō)|Fangupō]]. He died a few weeks after that, from disappointment?
And that was (one of) the reason that his children [[Tupouniua]] and Fangupō murdered Tukuʻaho in April 1799. {{Foki||Fīnau ʻUlukālala I ʻi Maʻofanga}}

page.title: Pepea
Fakahiku
Foua
Luanamo
Haʻafeva
page.category: Haʻapai
Hiva fakatonga
page.text:
[[File:Haʻafeva.gif|right|350px|thumb|Haʻafeva (motu + kolo)]] Ko '''Haʻafeva''' ko e motu ia ʻi [[Lulunga]], ʻa ia he tafaʻaki hihifo ʻo [[:Category:Haʻapai|Haʻapai]]. ʻOku tuʻu ʻi he tafaʻaki tokelauhahake. ʻOku tuʻu heni ʻa e ngaahi vaka lahi mei [[Nukuʻalofa]] ki [[Lifuka]] pe foki. ʻOku tuʻu ʻa e ngaahi kiʻi motu ʻi he takatakai, ko: * Fonumaka 19.933° S 174.701° W * Kolo 19.949° S 174.690° W * Leteoʻo 19.962° S 174.693° W, taʻemaaʻusia, ko e pununga manu tahi pē. * Onoiki 19.964° S 174.699° W ʻOku tuʻu ʻi ai ʻa e kolo ʻi hono tafaʻaki tokelauhihifo, ko '''Haʻafeva (kolo)''', 19.952° S 174.706° W. Ko e kolomuʻa ia ʻo Lulunga. Ko hono hingoa tenetene ko '''Kolo ngatata''', koeʻuhi ʻene fakaangina. ʻOku ʻi ai ʻa ʻene lautohi ʻe taha. ʻOku ʻi ai ha uafu ʻi he matāfonua hihifo, ko ''Polutu'', ofi ki he ʻesi motuʻa, ko ''Falefakauō''. ʻOku maumau ʻa e uafú ni ʻe he ngaahi afā meimei taimi kotoa pē. Fakatātā lolotonga ʻa e afā lahi ʻo 1961, naʻe ngoto ʻa e vaka fakapuleʻanga, ko e ''Fangaʻilifuka''. Naʻe fakaongoongoa ia ʻi he māʻimoa ʻo [[Sālote Tupou III]], ko e ''Hiva afā ʻo Vaea'' (vakai hifo). Ko e tofiʻa ia ʻo [[:Category:Tuʻuhetoka|Tuʻuhetoka]], kae ʻoku ʻi ai ʻa e tofiʻa ʻe taha ʻo e tuʻi ʻi he lotomālie ʻo e motu, ko ''Fakaʻosikato''. Ko e pale maʻa e ʻeiki ʻo e motú ni meia [[Siaosi Tupou I|Tāufaʻāhau]] maʻa ʻene haofakiʻi hono moʻui ʻi he tau ʻo [[Velata]]. [[File:matahiva.jpg|thumb|350px|left|Matahiva]]
ʻOku ongoongoa ʻa e kiʻi vaitupu ʻi hihifo, ko '''Matahiva''' (ko e ʻuhinga ʻoku ʻi ai ʻa e faliki ʻe 9 ʻi heʻene tuʻunga). Ko e vaitupu fakaʻotua ia ʻi he tukufakaholo, ʻe fakafokia ʻa e ngaahi manatu kapau te ke inu mei ai. Ko e angatuʻu ʻo e vaka HMAV ko ''Bounty'', naʻe hoko ʻi he takatakai ʻi 1789. == Hiva afā ʻo Vaea == Ne sikaʻahema fakahihifo loulouaʻa e matangi tō Kolongatata ke fakauōmahalo pe ko e leʻei ki Falefakauō ʻo falala he Fakaʻosikato ʻiseʻisa ē [[Kao]] mo [[Tofua]] vilingia hoto kie tāua kuo hola ʻa e Fangaʻilifuka tounoa e [[Maka-ko-Loupua]]. Pā ʻa e ui mo e fie uō ofo ʻa e [[Pangai|Fangafalikipako]] fine [[:Category:Haʻapai|Haʻapai]] ke fakafanongo ui ʻa e fangufangu ʻi he pō fakamafola ki he vahamamaʻo ko siʻoto [[salusalu]] manako ke talia ʻa e angi naʻa tō ke meʻite [[Sia-ko-Veiongo]]. Ka fehuʻi ʻe he [[Futu-ko-Vuna]] pe ʻekea ʻe he [[Kolovai|Taungapeka]]heliaki: [[:Category:Ata|Ata]] [[Tautavale]] peʻi ke tala he ko au ē ko e talatā ko e manusiu ʻo [[Tatakamotonga|Uoleva]]heliaki: [[:Category:Tungī|Tungī]] ko siʻeku meʻakai ko e fā ʻou inu hahau mo kai laʻā mohenga ʻi he fisi ʻo e naua. [[Neiafu|Lēlea]] ē, hoku ʻofa atu [[Taoa|Sia-ko-Kafoa]]heliaki: [[:Category:Tupoutoʻa|Tupoutoʻa]], [[Talau|Alo-i-Talau]] tangi ʻa e [[Pangai|Toatuʻuakitau]] he ko feofaaki a kakau fasi pē sila tuku ki [[Manono]] he fangu malingi ʻi [[Nukuʻalofa|Vahaʻakolo]] ne ngangatu ʻo alaha ʻi he loto kae tupulaki ofa i he moto ka faingataʻa pe faingofua Haʻapai tuʻu hoʻo taāimuʻa. {{Feituʻu Tonga|19°948|174°709}} * Langi tauʻolunga & hiva kakala; Nukuʻalofa 2000; ISBN 978-982-9800-71-8 [[Category:Haʻapai]] [[Category:Hiva fakatonga]]

page.title: Matuku
page.text:
[[Image:Matuku.gif|right|350px|thumb|Matuku (motu + kolo)]] Ko '''Matuku''' ko e kiʻi motu ia ʻi [[Lulunga]], ʻa ia he tafaʻaki hihifo ʻo [[:Category:Haʻapai|Haʻapai]]. ʻOku tuʻu ʻi he vahaʻa ʻo [[Haʻafeva]] mo [[Kotu]].
ʻOku tuʻu ʻi ai ʻa e kolo ʻi hono tafaʻaki tokelauhihifo, ko '''Matuku (kolo)''', 19.958° S 174.745° W. ʻOku ʻi ai ʻa ʻene lautohi ʻe taha. ʻOku ʻi ai ha uafu ʻi he matāfonua hahake, kae ʻoku ʻikai ngāueʻaki. Ko e fakatātā ʻo e tokoni fakatuʻapuleʻanga ʻoku liʻaki noa.
Ko e tofiʻa ia ʻo [[:Category:Tuʻihaʻateiho|Tuʻihaʻateiho]]. {{Feituʻu Tonga|19°964|174°743}} {{potuʻi}} [[category:Haʻapai]]

page.title: Kito
Putuputua
Fetoa
Teaupa
Tungua
page.text:
[[Image:Tungua.gif|right|350px|thumb|Tungua (motu + kolo)]] Ko '''Tungua''', pe '''Sani Tungua''', ko e motu ia ʻi [[Lulunga]], ʻa ia he tafaʻaki hihifo ʻo [[:Category:Haʻapai|Haʻapai]]. ʻOku tuʻu ʻi he tafaʻaki tongahihifo ʻo e pupungá ni. ʻOku ʻi ai ʻa e hakau ʻe 2 ʻi he tokelau ʻo Tungua, ʻi he fua ki [[Teaupa]]. Ko ''Luti'' ko e ʻuluaki, ko ''Hakau Russell'' ko e hoko.
ʻOku tuʻu ʻi ai ʻa e kolo ʻi hono matāfonua hahake (ʻoku ui ''Funga Fāʻimata''), ko '''Tungua (kolo)''', 20.018° S 174.759° W. Ko hono hingoa fakatenetene ko '''Tainamu ʻa Paea''' (ko e hingoa ia ʻo ha feituʻu ʻi he matātahi tokelau).
Ko e tofiʻa ia ʻo [[:Category:Tuʻihaʻateiho|Tuʻihaʻateiho]], kae ʻoku ʻi ai ʻa e tofiʻa ʻe taha ʻo e tuʻi ʻi he lotomālie ʻo e motu, ko '''ʻAlaloa'''.
==Tamahā== ʻOku ʻuhinga ʻoku sani ʻa Tungua ko e ʻafioʻanga ia ʻo e [[:Category:Tamahā|Tamahā]] mo honau moʻunga. Mahalo pē ʻi he kamataʻanga naʻe ʻafio ʻa e kau tamahā ʻi [[Lapaha]], kae koeʻuhi hono fakatouato, naʻe māʻolunga lahi ange honau tuʻunga ʻi he [[:Category:Tuʻi Tonga|Tuʻi Tonga]], naʻe sai ange ʻo nau ʻafio ʻi he feituʻu mamaʻo. {{Feituʻu Tonga|20°016|174°764}} {{potuʻi}} [[category:Haʻapai]] [[category:hisitōlia ʻo Tonga]] {{English|abstract}}

page.title: ʻOʻua
page.text:
[[Image:ʻOʻua.gif|right|350px|thumb|ʻOʻua (motu + kolo)]] Ko '''ʻOʻua''' ko e motu ia ʻi [[Lulunga]], ʻa ia he tafaʻaki hihifo ʻo [[:Category:Haʻapai|Haʻapai]]. ʻOku tuʻu ʻi he tafaʻaki tongahahake ʻo e pupungá ni.
ʻOku tuʻu ʻi ai ʻa e kolo ʻi hono matāfonua tonga, ko '''ʻOʻua (kolo)''', 20.040° S 174.681° W.
Ko e tofiʻa ia ʻo e puleʻanga ʻo Tonga. {{Feituʻu Tonga|20°038|174°679}} {{potuʻi}} [[category:Haʻapai]]

page.title: Tungua/en
page.text:
'''Tungua''' is the name of an island in the southwest of [[Lulunga]] in the [[:Category:Haʻapai|Haʻapai]] archipelago; 20°016 S, 174°764 W. Two reefs to the north, in the direction of [[Teaupa]] are called ''Luti'' (the nearest) and ''Russell reef''.
Its village, '''Tungua (township)''' is located along its eastshore, named ''Funga Fāʻimata''. Its nickname is '''Tainamu ʻa Paea''' (Orphan's mosquito net), strictly speaking the name of a place at the northern coast.
The island belongs to the estate of [[:Category:Tuʻihaʻateiho|Tuʻihaʻateiho]], but there is also a royal estate in the centre, named '''ʻAlaloa'''.
The reason Tungua is also called '''Sani Tungua''' (glorious Tungua) is becuse it was the residence of the [[:Category:Tamahā|Tamahā]], the royal princesses, and several are buried there in huge mounds. If originally the princesses lived in [[Lapaha]], then due to the [[fahu]] system their aristocratic rank was so high, higher than that of the [[:Category:Tuʻi Tonga|Tuʻi Tonga]] king himself, that it interfered with the matters of state, so it was better that they were far out of the way. {{Foki||Tungua}}

page.title: Kotu
page.text:
[[Image:Kotu.gif|right|350px|thumb|Kotu (motu + kolo)]] Ko '''Kotu''' ko e kiʻi motu, motu hihifo taha ia ʻi [[Lulunga]], ʻa ia he tafaʻaki hihifo ʻo [[:Category:Haʻapai|Haʻapai]].
ʻOku tuʻu ʻi ai ʻa e kolo, ko '''Kotu (kolo)''', ʻi he lotomālie ʻo e motú ni.
Ko Kotu ko e motu mahuʻinga taha ʻi Lulunga ʻo kau ki he ʻulungāanga fakatonga. ʻOku ongoongoa ʻa e kau faiva mo punake ō mai mei ai.
Ko e tofiʻa ia ʻo e puleʻanga ʻo Tonga. {{Feituʻu Tonga|19°948|174°797}} {{potuʻi}} [[category:Haʻapai]]

page.title: Tuʻuhetoka/en
page.text: The reason that this line of minor chiefs of a small island was elevated by king [[Siaosi Tupou I|Tāufaʻāhau I]] to the status of a noble, was because one of its ancestors once saved the latter from losing a decisive battle and even death at [[Velata]] in 1826. When Tāufaʻāhau had come to [[Haʻafeva]] to ask the chief for help with his war against [[Sanualio Laufilitonga]], initially the chief did not want to help him, having his allegiance with the other. But when his sister threatened to go instead, he switched loyalty, and fought close to Tāufaʻāhau. Then the latter was hit on the head by several attackers and lay unconscious on the ground. The Haʻafeva chief fought off all the enemies until Tāufaʻāhau became conscious again. Later this warrior was named "Tuʻu-he-toka" meaning "''Standing while the chief is sleeping''". Interesting note: if Tāufaʻāhau would have been a commoner instead of a chief, the proper term were tuʻu-he-mohe, if he would already have been king then, tuʻu-he-tōfā were to be used. {{Foki|f|Tuʻuhetoka}}

page.title: Velata
Maka-ko-Loupua
page.category: Talatukufakaholo
page.text:
Ko e '''Maka ko Loupua''' ko e maka ia ʻi he toafa ʻo e matātahi ʻo [[Tongoleleka]], tafaʻi Haʻatoʻu ʻi [[Lifuka]]. Naʻe peheeʻi ʻoku lava ngaue ʻa e maká ni ʻe he houʻeiki pē.
ʻOku faʻa ngāueʻaki ʻi he ngaahi taʻanga ʻa e heliaki maʻa e houʻeiki mo e faleʻalo. {{potuʻi}} [[Category:Talatukufakaholo]]

page.title: Makamālohi
Solomone ʻAlokuoʻulu Tuita (Tuʻiniua)
page.text: {{Kāinga ofi|faʻahinga=houʻeiki |hokohoko=Tuita Sʻ |maama=tangata |tamai=[[ʻIsileli Tupou Tuita (Toluafe)]] |faʻē= [[Luseane Halaevalu Mataʻaho Unga (Fotofili)]] |ʻaho fanauʻi=~1920? |ʻaho pekia= 7 Sēpitema 1996 |taʻokete-tokoua={{tokoua|[[Siosaia Aleamotuʻa Laufilitonga Tuita]]|[[Makahokovalu Tuita]]|||||||}} |taʻokete-lau={{tokoua| | |||||||}} |tehina-tokoua={{tokoua|[[Vilisoni Fahitaha Namoa]]||||||||}} |ʻohoana1=ʻOuita Sela Tuita (Wolfgramm) († 8 Siulai 2003) |ʻaho1= |fānau1={{tokoua|(toko-13)||||||||||}} |}}*http://www.planet-tonga.com/language_journal/Fakaanaua_a_Ouita.shtml Meʻa ʻi [[Senē]] pea pekia ʻi ai.

page.title: Makahokovalu Tuita
page.text: {{Kāinga ofi|faʻahinga=houʻeiki |hokohoko=Tuita M |maama=tangata |tamai=[[ʻIsileli Tupou Tuita (Toluafe)]] |faʻē= [[Luseane Halaevalu Mataʻaho Unga (Fotofili)]] |ʻaho fanauʻi=~1920? |ʻaho pekia=13 Maʻasi 1948 |taʻokete-tokoua={{tokoua|[[Siosaia Aleamotuʻa Laufilitonga Tuita]]||||||||}} |taʻokete-lau={{tokoua| ||||||||}} |tehina-tokoua={{tokoua|[[Solomone ʻAlokuoʻulu Tuita (Tuʻiniua)]]|[[Vilisoni Fahitaha Namoa]]|||||||}} |}}Pekia ʻi Neiafu

page.title: Sela Lepolo Tuita (ʻUnga)
ʻOsaiasi Tonga Veikune
Manulevu
Tongafaleola
Kiʻi pusi
page.category: Hiva valevale
page.text:
ʻOku ua ʻa e hiva kau ki he '''kiʻi pusi'''
Kiʻi pusi, kiʻi pusi kaka he fuʻu fusi tō ki lalo, mahele ho ʻusi.
Kiʻi pusi, kiʻi pusi naʻa ke ʻi fē ai pē he ʻahó ni? naʻa ku ʻalu ki Lonitoni ʻo ʻaʻahi ki he kuiní. (pe: ...mo e kuiní)
[[Category:Hiva valevale]]

page.title: Fonongahina
page.text: [[Image:Fonongahina.gif|right|350px|thumb|Fonongahina (ʻuta)]] Ko '''Fonongahina''' (pe Fanongahina ?) ko e pupunga ʻo e ngaahi ʻapi ʻuta ʻi he tonga ʻo [[Tokomololo]], ʻi he hala ki [[ʻUtulau]]. ʻOku ʻikai ha ngaahi ʻapi kolo ʻi ai, kae ko e tofiʻa ʻo [[:Category:Lasike|Lasike]] pē. {{potuʻi}} [[category:Tongatapu & takatakai]]

page.title: Loʻau
page.category: Talatukufakaholo
page.text:
Ko '''Loʻau''' ko e hingoa ia ʻo e kau tangata poto mo fai-ʻalunga, naʻe ʻasi mai ʻi he hisitōlia ʻo Tonga. Ko e ʻeiki lahi ia, taimi ʻe niʻihi, mahalo pē ha tuʻi, ko e tuʻi ʻo [[Haʻamea]].
Ko Loʻau ko e ʻeiki muli. ʻOku mahaloʻi ko e ʻeiki lahi mei Vaihi (Hawaiʻi) naʻe ʻiloa ko Lāʻau. <ref>Kaʻili, Tēvita. 2017. Marking Indigeneity: The Tongan Art of Sociospatial Relations. Tucson: University of Arizon Press. See pages 69-76.</ref>
Ko Loʻau ʻe taha naʻe moʻui ʻi he taimi ʻo e [[:Category:Tuʻi Tonga|Tuʻi Tonga]] ko [[Momo]]. Ko e tuʻi ʻo [[Haʻamea]] ia. Naʻe ʻi ai hono ongo ʻofefine, ko [[Nua]] mo hono tehina ko Velenga. Naʻe mamana ʻaupito ʻa Momo kia Nua, pea naʻe fietaʻane. Ko e tuʻi lahi, ko [[Tuʻitātui]] naʻe hona ʻalo.
Ko Loʻau ʻe taha, ko e [[matāpule]] lahi pē ʻo ha Tuʻi Tonga. Naʻa ne folau ki [[ʻEueiki]], meimei naʻa ne kamata kai ʻa [[Kavaʻonau]]. Pea naʻa ne faʻufoʻou ʻa e inu ʻo e [[kava]] mo e [[tō (akau)|tō]].
Ko Lo'au ʻe taha, naʻa ne meʻa ʻi Haʻamea ʻi he vahe hihifo ʻo [[:category:Tongatapu & takatakai|Tongatapu]]. Naʻa ne tukufolau ʻa hono kalia, tūkufua ki he ngaahi fonua taʻeiloa mo mamaʻo ʻaupito. (Vākai ki he talatukufakaholo ʻo e [[folau ʻa Kae]].)
{{potuʻi}} [[category:Hisitōlia ʻo Tonga]] [[Category:Talatukufakaholo]]

page.title: Toa
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Ironwood |faitā= Casuarina equisetifolia fruits.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[fagales]] |familia= [[CASUARINACEAE]] |genus= Casuarina |species= equisetifolia |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= c }} [[File:Casuarina equisetifolia MHNT.BOT.2016.24.39.jpg|thumb|''Casuarina equisetifolia”]]
Ko e '''toa''' ko ha fuʻu ʻakau fakaʻeiki ia. Sai maʻa e ʻā ʻo e ngaahi ʻapi meʻaʻanga pē. Pe maʻa e moʻunga (faʻitoka). Fakatātā, vakai ki he Halatoaongo ([[ʻUiha]]).
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *Toa tepi
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *toa ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *nokonoko ([[lea fakafisi]]) *ʻaito ([[lea fakatahisi]], ''toa'' ʻi he lea fakatahisi motuʻa)
==Toe meʻa kehe== ʻOku tui ʻe he kakai ʻi he ʻotu motu Polinisia kehe ko e ''toa'' (fuʻu ʻakau) ʻoku tatau mo e ''toa'' (tangata tau). Kae ʻi Tongá ni ʻoku ʻiloa ʻoku ʻikai ia. Ko e ''toʻa'' ko e aka ʻo e foʻi lea maʻa e tangata tau.
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Siaosi Kiu Tau-ki-vailahi Kaho
page.link: Simon Tuʻihaʻatuʻunga George Maʻulupekotofa Ngalumoetutulu Tuʻivakanō

page.title: Pusi
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Cat |faitā= Collage of Six Cats-02.jpg |regnum= [[monumanu]] |phylum= [[monumanu filo siliva]] |classis= [[monumanu fakahuhu]] |ordo= [[monumanu kai kanomate]] |familia= [[FELIDAE]] |genus= Felis |species= catus |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|Linnaeus]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e kiʻi monumanu fakaʻofoʻofa ia.
ʻOku tatau mo e ''Felis domesticus'' pe ''Felis silvestris''. {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Koka
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Java cedar |faitā= Bischofia javanica (flowers,leaves).jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malpighiales]] |familia= [[PHYLLANTHACEAE]] pe [[EUPHORBIACEAE]] |genus= Bischofia |species= javanica |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carl Ludwig Blume|Blume]] |fehokotaki= cs |}} [[File:Bischofia javanica, fruits.jpg|320px|left|thumb|Ngaahi foʻi fua.]] [[Image:Bischofia javanica flowering.jpg|320px|left|thumb|Ngaahi foʻi matala, ʻoku ne matala ʻi Fēpueli ʻi Tongá ni.]] Ko e '''koka''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia.
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *koka ([[lea fakaʻuvea]]) *ʻoʻa ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *koka, nato ([[lea fakakuki]]) *koka, togotogo ([[lea fakafisi]])
==Toe meʻa kehe== Naʻe tuʻu ʻa e fuʻu ʻe taha ʻi [[Kolovai]], ko e tāloni fakanofo ʻo e [[:Category:Tuʻi Kanokupolu|Tuʻi Kanokupolu]] ia. ʻOku pulia he taimí ni, kae ʻoku tupu ʻa e kiʻi fuʻu foʻou.
ʻOku ngāueʻaki ʻa e kiliʻiʻakau maʻa e vali, ko e '''huʻa koka''', maʻa e [[kokaʻanga]]. ==Tataku== *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/bischofia_javanica.htm *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=5820 *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Ahi
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Sandalwood tree |faitā= Santalum yasi.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[santalales]] |familia= [[SANTALACEAE]] |genus= Santalum |species= yasi |fakamoʻoniʻanga= Bertero }} Ko e '''ahi''' ko ha fuʻu ʻakau fakatuʻi ia, mo e ʻakau manongi ʻaupito. Ko e [[kakala ʻiloa]] ia. ʻOku tatau mo e ''Santalum insulare''.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * ahi; koʻeni * ahivao, ''Acronycha niueana'' * ahivao, ''Vavaea amicorum'' (MELIACEAE); vakai foki ki he [[takafalu]] * [[kalaka|ahikaulolo]] * [[ahisiaina]]
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * asi, asi manogi ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * ahi ([[lea fakatahisi]]) * yasi ([[lea fakafisi]]) * ʻili-ahi ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) * aʻi, maramia ([[lea fakakuki]])
== Toe meʻa kehe == Ko e '''ahi mo e [[vunga]]''' ko e heliaki ia maʻa e [[:Category:tuʻi ʻo Tonga|tuʻi ʻo Tonga]], koeʻuhi naʻe tupu ʻa e ongo ʻakau ʻi he funga ʻo e [[Sia ko Veiongo]]. Kuo pulia he taimí ni.
== Tataku == * http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6628 * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Heilala
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |faitā=Garcinia sessilis, flower.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malpighiales]] |familia= [[CLUSIACEAE]] |tribus= [[GARCINIEAE]] |genus= Garcinia |species= sessilis |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Forster]]) [[Seemann|Seem.]] |fehokotaki= }} [[File:Garcinia sessilis.jpg|left|280px|thumb|Ko e heilala, ko e fuʻu ʻakau kei mui]] [[File:Garcinia sessilis, yellow flower.jpg|left|280px|thumb|ʻOku tātātaha ʻa e matala engeenga]] Ko e '''heilala''' ko ha fuʻu ʻakau fakatuʻi ia, mo e ʻakau namu lelei ʻaupito. Ko e [[kakala ʻiloa]] ʻuluaki ʻaupito ia. Ko e kiʻi matalaʻiʻakau kulamaama (pe engeengamaama) ko e fakaʻilonga fakafonua ʻa [[Tonga]] ia.
ʻOku ui foki ko e ''Garcinia callophylum''. Ko e hingoa ʻo e kāinga fakasaienisi onopooni ko e ''Clusiaceae'' ia, kae ʻoku ui foki ''Guttiferae'' pe ''Hypericaceae''.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == *heilala pulu (ʻoku fuaʻi; oku ui ko e ''pulupaki'' ʻa e ngaahi tenga ʻosi tō hifo) *heilala fisiʻiniu (ʻoku ʻikai te ne fuaʻi)
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == *seilala ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]])
== Tataku == *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Mango (ʻakau)
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |hingoa=Mango |name= Mango |faitā= Black mango unripe.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[sapindales]] |familia= [[ANACARDIACEAE]] |genus= Mangifera |species= indica |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''mango''' ko ha fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia, manakoa koeʻuhi ʻene fakamalumaluʻi mo ʻene ʻū foʻi fua ifo ʻi he faʻahitaʻu mafana. ʻOku ngāueʻaki ʻi he [[ʻotai]].
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * mango lesi * mango ʻāpele * mango ʻInitia * mango kaimata — fua melie pea sai ʻene kai teʻeki moho * mango kalasini — fua namukū he kalasini * mango lesi — fua lelei taha, hoholahi tauloto * mango nui — fua lālahi ʻaupito mo e hā fua
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * mago ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]])
== Toe meʻa kehe == [[File:Carica papaya 1 (Piotr Kuczynski).jpg|left|200px]] Ko e '''kuinisi''' (mei he ''quince'' ʻi he lea fakapilitānia) ko e faʻahinga mango ia, ko e ''Mangifera odorata''. Kae mahalo pē ʻoku hala, koeʻuhi ko e ''quince'' moʻoni ko e ''Cydonia oblonga'' ia. [[Image:Mango tree Kerala in full bloom.jpg|thumb|180px|A mango tree in full bloom in Kerala, India]] == Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Vī
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Tahitian/Cytherian/golden apple |faitā=Starr_980529-4218_Spondias_dulcis.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[sapindales]] |familia= [[ANACARDIACEAE]] |genus= Spondias |species= dulcis |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= c }} [[image:Spondias_dulcis3.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Ko e fua]] Ko e '''vī''' ko ha fuʻu ʻakau pe ko hono foʻi fua. ʻOku ui foki ko e ''Spondias cytherea''.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *vī vao (fua siʻisiʻi pē) *vī taha, ''Pisonia aculeata'' (NYCTAGINACEAE) *vītahi, ''Ximenia americana'' pe ''X. elliptica'' (OLACACEAE) *vītahi, malamalaʻa toa, ''Memecylon harveyi'' (MELASTOMACEAE)
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehekehe== *vī ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) **moli tai (''Ximenia americana'') *kedondong (Bahasa Indonesia) *Tahitian apple, Otaheite apple, golden apple, hogplum, Polynesian plum ([[lea fakapilitānia]]) *ambarella ([[lea fakaholani]]) *évi (Réunion) *hevi ([[lea fakafilipaina]]) *mokah (Cambodia) *gway (Myanmar) *marak farang (Thailand) *prune Cythère, pomme Cythère ([[lea fakafalanisē]]) *Goldpflaume ([[lea fakasiamane]])
==Toe meʻa kehe== Ko e kāinga ʻoku ui Vī, vakai kia [[:Category:Veʻehala|Veʻehala]].
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Fetoʻumaka
Mei ʻinitia
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Jackfruit |faitā= Jackfruit.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[rosales]] |familia= [[MORACEAE]] |genus= Artocarpus |species= heterophyllus |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Jean-Baptiste Lamarck|Lam.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''mei ʻinitia''' ko ha fuʻu ʻakau mo haʻane foʻi fua, ʻoku meimei tatau ʻenau ʻasi mo e foʻi [[mei]].
== Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Kaute
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Chinese/Red hibiscus |faitā= Hibiskus rosa-sinensis - Kwiat.JPG |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malvales]] |familia= [[MALVACEAE]] |genus= Hibiscus |species= rosa-sinensis |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} [[File:Hibiscus01.jpg|left|thumb|320px|''H. syriacus'' engeenga]] [[File:Hibiscus syriacus Blue bird.jpg|left|thumb|320px|''H. syriacus'' lanumoana]] [[File:Hibiscus schizopetalus.jpg|left|thumb|240px|''H. schizopetalus'']] Ko e '''kaute''' ko e ʻakau mo e ngaahi matalaʻiʻakau lahi mo e kulokula pe, taimi ʻe niʻihi: engeenga pe hinehina. ʻOku ʻikai ʻaupito ʻi ai haʻane namu.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == *kaute; koʻeni, ko e ngaahi lauʻimatala fakamanumi mo e pikoʻi ki mui, ko e kau fisiʻiʻakau loa *kaute, ''H. syriacus'' L. [Rose of Sharon]; ko e ngaahi lauʻimatala molemole mo e pikoʻi ki muʻa, ko e kau fisiʻiʻakau nonou *kaute, ''H. schizopetalus'' (Masters) Hookers [Fringed hibiscus]; ko e ngaahi lauʻimatala vahevahe mo e pikoʻi ki mui, ko e kau fisiʻiʻakau lōloa *[[fau]] *[[kaute mohe]]
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == *ʻaute ([[lea fakatahisi]], [[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *kaute ʻenua, kaute kura ([[lea fakakuki]], ''H. rosa-sinensis'') **kaute vareʻau (''H. syriacus'') **kaute verevere, kaute veri (''H. schizopetalus'')
== Tataku == *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6230 *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Fau
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Sea or Beach hibiscus |faitā= Hibiscus tiliaceus.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malvales]] |familia= [[MALVACEAE]] |genus= Hibiscus |species= tiliaceus |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''fau''' ko e ʻakau lahi mo e ngaahi matalaʻiʻakau engeenga, kae ʻoku ʻikai haʻane namu. ʻOku sai ʻene tupu ofi ki he matātahi, ʻa ia hono ongo hingoa ʻi he [[lea fakapilitānia]]. ʻOku ui foki ko e ''Hawaiʻian hibiscus'' pe ''Giant hibiscus''.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *fauhina *faukula *[[faumalila]] *fauʻolongā *fauʻingo, loa (''Hibiscus abelmoschus'' L.) *fauʻakio *[[kaute]] *[[kaute mohe]]
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *fau tagaloa ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *fau ([[lea fakaʻuvea]], [[lea fakafutuna]]) *vau ([[lea fakafisi]]) *pūrau ([[lea fakatahisi]], ''hau'' ʻi he ISV) *hau ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) *fou ([[lea fakaniuē]]) *ʻau ([[lea fakakuki]])
==Toe meʻa kehe== ʻOku ngāueʻaki ʻene kiliʻiʻakau maʻa e fau (maea) mo e [[manafau]] mo e [[taʻovala]] mo e hā fua.
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler; ISBN 978-0-8248-1528-8 *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Pele
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Sunset muskmallow |faitā= Abelmoschus_esculentus.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malvales]] |familia= [[MALVACEAE]] |genus= Abelmoschus |species= manihot |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]]) [[Medik]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''pele''' ko e ʻakau mo e ngaahi matalaʻiʻakau engeenga meimei tatau mo e [[fau]]. ʻOku moʻoni he onoʻaho naʻe vahevahe ʻa e pele ʻe he kau saienisi ki he kāinga ofi ʻo e ''hibiscus'', kae he onopooni naʻa nau fili ʻa e kāinga ofi kehe, ko e ''abelmoschus''.
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * ''Hibiscus manihot'' ([[lea fakalatina]], ʻikai ke toe ngāueʻaki) * sunset hibiscus ([[lea fakapilitānia]], tatau) * bele ([[lea fakafisi]], mei hē ko e hingoa fakatonga) * pacific spinach (koeʻuhi ʻoku kai lahi ʻa e ngaahi lau ʻe he kakai Tonga, ʻoku vave ʻene tupu pea ʻoku maʻamaʻa) * sweet hibiscus (koeʻuhi ʻoku lelei ki he kai ko e meʻa kotoa pē ʻo e ʻakaú ni) * hibiscus spinach * aibika ([[lea fakapapua]], ko e feituʻu tupuʻanga) * ailan kapis ([[lea fakavanuatu]]) * tororo aoi (トロロアオイ, [[lea fakasiapani]])
ʻOku meimei tatau mo e ''okra'' pe ''lady fingers'', kae ko e faʻahinga kehe ia, ko e ''Abelmoschus esculentus'' (''Hibiscus esculentus'' he onoʻaho).
== Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 * http://www.itis.gov/servlet/SingleRpt/SingleRpt?search_topic=TSN&search_value=21771 * http://www.png-gossip.com/news/g010529.html {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Paini
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Norfolk pine |faitā=The pine road.jpg |faitālaulahi= 250px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[pinophyta]] |classis= [[pinopsida]] |ordo= [[pinales]] |familia= [[ARAUCARIACEAE]] |genus= Araucaria |species= heterophylla |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Richard Anthony Salisbury|Salisb.]]) Franco |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''paini''' ko e ʻakau lahi mei he motu [[Norfolk]] pe ofi ki ai.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * paini; koʻeni, pe ''Araucaria excelsa'' * paini, ''Pinus sp.'' (PINACEAE)
[[File:Hala paini.gif|thumb|left|Kupesi: ko e hala paini]] == Toe meʻa kehe == Ko e ʻakau fakatuʻi ia, tupu ʻi [[Malaʻepangai]] (ko e ngaahi ''Paini muʻa'') mo e Hala Paini (Hala Tuʻi, mei he pālasi ki [[Malaʻekula]], vakai he faitā). Kae ʻoku pulia ʻa e konga lahi he taimí ni koeʻuhi ʻenau motuʻa. ''Ko e hala paini'' ko e [[kupesi]] manakoa ia.<br clear=left>
== Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * [http://www.conifers.org/ar/ar/heterophylla.htm Gymnosperm Database: ''Araucaria heterophylla''] * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Vunga
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Heartwood (sp) |faitā= MetrosiderosTahiti467.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[Myrtales]] |familia= [[Myrtaceae]] |genus= Metrosideros |species= collina |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Joseph Banks|Banks]] ex [[Joseph Gaertner|Gaertn.]] |fehokotaki= c }} Ko e '''vunga''' ko ha fuʻu ʻakau fakatuʻi ia, mo e ʻakau namu lelei ʻaupito. Ko e [[kakala ʻiloa]] ia.
ʻOku ʻauhamālie ʻi Tongá ni, kae kei tupu ʻi he kāungafonua. Mahalo pē ko e vunga ʻi Tongá ni naʻe tatau mo e fakakeheʻi ʻo Fisi: ʻoku ʻikai, pe siʻisiʻi pē hano matalaʻiʻakau, ʻoku ʻikai ha kākunga ki [[Tahisi]] pe [[Hauaiʻi]] pe ko e ''pōhutukawa'' ʻi [[Nuʻu Sila]]; pea ʻoku ʻikai fuopotopoto hono lau, ʻoku lōloa mo e lanu kopa maʻa e lau mui (tatau mo e [[heilala]]).
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *vuga ([[lea fakafisi]], ''M. collina'' var. ''vitiensis'') *ʻanume ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]], vakai foki ki he [[kānume]]) *puarata ([[lea fakatahisi]], ''M. collina'' var. ''villosa'' pe ''M. kermadecensis'' (Tahiti); matalaʻiʻakau lahi, vakai he faitaá) *ʻōhiʻa lehua ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]], ''M. collina'' var. ''polymorpha'' (Springfield); matalaʻiʻakau lahi)
==Toe meʻa kehe== ʻOku toe pē hono hingoa ʻi he kupuʻilea heliaki: ''[[ahi]] mo e vunga''.
==Tataku== *http://www.redlandsnursery.com.au/infonotes/msfiji.htm faitā vunga moʻoni *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Tapanima
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Carambola, Starfruit |faitā= Carambola2.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[Oxalidales]] |familia= [[Oxalidaceae]] |genus= Averrhoa |species= carambola |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} [[File:Averrhoa carambola flowers.jpg|left|thumb|320px|matalaʻiʻakau]] Ko e '''tapanima''' ko ha fuʻu ʻakau mo hono lau siʻisiʻi pea mo hono ngaahi foʻi fua tapa nima. ʻOku fakatau ʻa e ngaahi foʻi fua ʻi he maketi ʻi Tongá ni.
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * raparapa ([[lea fakakuki]])
== Tataku == * http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=5795
<br clear="all"> <gallery caption="Ngaahi foʻi fua" widths="200px"> Image:Have-23.jpg Image:Averrhoa carambola dsc07815.jpg Image:Averrhoa carambola ARS k5735-7.jpg </gallery> {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Sī
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Ti plant |faitā= Cordyline terminalis dsc03651.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻitaha]] |ordo= [[Asparagales]] |familia= [[Laxmanniaceae]] |genus= Cordyline |species= fruticosa |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Carolus Linnaeus|L]].) A. Chev. |fehokotaki= c }} [[File:Cordyline fruticosa, flowering.jpg|left|320px|thumb|ko e sī tongotongo ʻi heʻene matala]] Ko e '''sī''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi mo haʻane ngaahi foʻi lau lahi. Ko hono aka, kapau motuʻa ʻa e ʻakau, ʻoku mēlie ʻaupito.
ʻI onoʻaho naʻe vahavaheʻi ia ʻi he kāinga ʻo e ''Agavaceae'' pe ''Liliaceae'', ʻoku teʻeki pau ʻa e kau saienisi. Pehē pē ʻoku toe lahi hano ʻuhinga tatau: * ''Convallaria fruticosa'' L. (basionym) * ''Asparagus terminalis'' L. (hingoa taʻefakalao) * ''Cordyline terminalis'' (L.) Kunth (koeʻuhi haʻane ngāueʻaki he ʻā) * ''Cordyline terminalis'' var. ''ferra'' Baker * ''Dracaena terminalis'' L., Lam. (hingoa taʻefakalao) * ''Dracaena terminalis'' Rich. * ''Terminalis fruticosa'' (L.) Kuntze
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * sī melo * sī kula (lau kulokula, vakai ki he ʻata ʻi mataʻu) * sī leʻa pe sī mataleʻa * sī tongotongo (lau lanumata) * sī kauvalu * sī matani
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * kī ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) * tī ([[lea fakamauli]], [[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * ʻautī ([[lea fakatahisi]], (ko e ''tī'' ko e aka pē) * masawe ([[lea fakafisi]]) * langue de femme (Réunion: ʻelelo ʻo e fefine)
== Toe meʻa kehe == Ko e lau ʻoku ngāueʻaki he [[sisi]], ko e teunga faiva.
== Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: ʻOvava
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Strangler fig, Banyan |faitā= Banyan tree02.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[urticales]] |familia= [[MORACEAE]] |genus= Ficus |species= macrophylla |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= c }} [[Image:Ficus on Bischofia javanica.jpg|left|280px|thumb|ʻOku noʻouʻa ʻa e [[koka]] ʻe he ʻovava]] Ko e '''ʻovava''' ko ha fuʻu ʻakau lahi ʻaupito ia.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *ʻovava, ''Ficus prolixa'', ''Ficus obliqua'', [Polynesian banyan] *ʻovava tonga, ''Ficus macrophylla'', [Moreton Bay banyan] *ʻovava fisi, ''Ficus benjamina'', [Weeping banyan] *ʻovava siaina, ''Ficus retusa'', [Chinese banyan] *[[fiki kai]] *[[masi]] (masipā, masiʻata) *[[fiki]]; ngaahi fiki kehe, ''Jatropha'' sp.
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *aoa, mati ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]], ''Ficus prolixa'') *oraʻa ([[lea fakatahisi]]) *ava, āoa ([[lea fakakuki]])
==Toe meʻa kehe== ʻI Tongá ni ʻoku ʻasi ko Hina ʻi heʻene tutu ʻi lalo ʻovava, ʻi he [[māhina]] kātoa.
==Tataku== *Multipurpose trees for agroforestry in the Pacific islands; R.R. Thaman, C.R. Elevitch, K.M. Wilkinson *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: ʻovava

page.title: Masi
Vālai
Uhi
Hiapo
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Paper Mulberry |faitā= Broussonetia papyrifera fruits.jpg |faitālaulahi=240px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[rosales]] |familia= [[MORACEAE]] |genus=Broussonetia |species=papyrifera |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]]) [[Étienne Pierre Ventenat|Vent.]] |fehokotaki= c }}
Ko e '''hiapo''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau ia.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *hiehiapo
<gallery mode=packed> Murier.jpg Broussonetia papyrifera - Botanischer Garten Freiburg - DSC06385.jpg Broussonetia papyrifera - fleurs mâles.jpg Broussonetia papyrifera MHNT Texture of the trunk.jpg </gallery>
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *ʻaute ([[lea fakatahisi]] (tatau mo e [[kaute]]) *uʻa ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *aute ([[lea fakamauli]])
==Toe meʻa kehe== Ko e meʻa mahuʻinga taha ʻo e ʻakaú ni ko hono kiliʻiʻakau, ko e tupuʻanga ʻo e [[fetaʻaki]].
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Nonu
Niu
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Coconut palm |faitā=Cocos_nucifera_-_Köhler–s_Medizinal-Pflanzen-187.jpg |faitālaulahi=218px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻitaha]] |ordo= [[arecales]] |familia= [[ARECACEAE]] |genus=Cocos |species=nucifera |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= cs }}
Ko e '''niu''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau mahuʻinga taha ʻo e Pasifiki.
== Ko e ngaahi konga ʻo e niu == [[File:Coconut art 06.jpg|left|thumb|150px]] * niu, fuʻu niu: ko e fuʻu * niu, foʻi niu: ko e tenga * niu; ko e kilimi pe huʻakau-niu * kaka; ko e "kupenga" kākālavā takatakaiʻi he louniu mui * kota; ko e toenga ʻosi he niuvao ʻo e huʻakau-niu * loholoho; ʻoku tupu ʻa e foʻi niu mei hē * mataka; ko e kakano ʻo e foʻi niu motuʻu, ʻosi mōmoa (copra, [[lea fakapilitānia]]) * namoa; ko e kakano ʻo e foʻi niu mata, ko e kai lelei maʻa e fānau valevale * palalafa; ʻoku tupu ʻa e ngaahi foʻi lou siʻi mei hē, ko e kau ʻo e louniu kotoa * pulu; ko e kafukafu ʻo e foʻi niu*tōlau; louniu mui, kamataʻanga ʻo ʻene muka * tuʻaniu; ko e kau ʻo e ngaahi foʻi lou siʻi takitaha ʻo e louniu
== Ko e fakatupu ʻo e foʻi niu == * pōniu; ko e kamataʻanga ʻo e foʻi niu foʻou * niu ngono * niu matangono * niu matavelivali; sai maʻa e hihiloku * niu mata; lanumata, sai ke inu (veifua) * niu matahihiloku * niu matamotomoto * niu motomoto * niu motuʻu; lanu melomelo, tō ki lalo * niu matasili; ʻoku kamata muka * (niu) ʻuto; sai ke tō * (niu) ʻuto papanaki
* mataʻali, takalekale; foʻi niu kuo lavea, pea tō kei siʻi * nginingini; foʻi niu motuʻa ʻaupito, mōmoa ʻi loto, pea mate
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * niu huhu * niu kafa; ko e pulu lahi, sai taha maʻa e [[kafa]] ** niu kafa mea ** niu kafa ʻui * niu kafakala; sai taha maʻa e [[veihalo]] * niu kula * niu lauʻuto; ʻikai vahevahaʻi kakato ʻa e ngaahi lou * niu loholohotaha; mo e loholoho taʻemangaʻi * niu matakula * niu mea; ʻoku lanu melomelo ʻa e foʻi niu * niu meatoto; ʻoku lanu kula ʻa e foʻi niu * niu meaʻalava; ʻoku ʻalava ʻa e foʻi niu * niu meleni * niu puleua; ko e foʻi niu lanuua, melomelo ʻi ʻolunga, lanumata ʻi lalo * niu pulufufula * niu taʻokave; ko e foʻiniu iiki * niu tea; ʻoku tea ʻa e lou mo e foʻi niu * niu vai; ko e foʻi niu lahi * niu ʻui; * niu ʻutoungau; ko e pulu melie * paame; ko e ngaahi ʻakau meimei tatau mo e niu, ʻi he [[lea fakapilitānia]]: ** betelnut palm, ''Areca catechu'' (PALMAE) ** clustered fishtail, ''Caryota mitis'' (PALMAE) ** butterfly palm, ''Chrysalidocarpus lutescens'' (PALMAE) ** macarthur's palm, ''Ptychosperma macarthur'' (PALMAE) ** sealing wax palm, ''Cyrtostachys renda'' (PALMAE) ** princess palm, ''Dictyosperma album'' (PALMAE) ** royal palm, ''Roystene regia'' (PALMAE) * [[piu]]
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * niu ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]], [[lea fakafisi]], [[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) * haʻari ([[lea fakatahisi]]) * nū ([[lea fakakuki]])
== Toe meʻa kehe == ʻOku ʻi ai?
== Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Ngingie
Fā
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Screw pine |faitā=Pandanus tectorius roots&branches.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻitaha]] |ordo= [[pandanales]] |familia= [[PANDANACEAE]] |genus=Pandanus |species=tectorius |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Sydney Parkinson|Parkinson]] ex Zucc. |fehokotaki= c }} Ko e '''fā''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau ia, ʻoku tupu ofi ki he tahi, sai ʻene tupu ʻi he matāliku. ʻOku ui foki ko e ''Pandanus odoratissimus'' (fā namulelei).
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == *fā, ''Pandanus tectorius'' — ko e [[kakala vale]] *fāhina, fātea, ''Pandanus odoratissimus pseudolinnaei'' — ko e [[kakala vale]] *fā lotuma *fāvula, ''Pandanus odoratissimus pyriformis'' *falahola, ''Pandanus odoratissimus sinensis'' — ʻoku tui tatau mo e fākula ʻe he kakai Tonga, ko e [[kakala ʻiloa]] *fākula, ''Pandanus corallinus'' — ko e [[kakala ʻiloa]] māʻolunga fika 2 *fāfā, ''Pandanus corallinus'' *hingano, ''Pandanus odoratissimus setchelii'' — ko hono matalaʻiʻakau hinehina ʻoku ui ko e ''hafu'' pe ''hafuʻihingano'', ko hono moto ko e ''lūpū'' pe ''lūpuuʻihingano'', ko e [[kakala vale]] *kukuvalu, ''Pandanus odoratissimus savaiensis'' — ko ʻene matalaʻiʻakau, ko e [[kakala ʻiloa]] *louʻakau — lou lahi, sai maʻa e lalanga *loukie, ''Pandanus corallinus'' — ʻoku ngāueʻaki ʻene lou ki he lalanga [[kie]] *loutotolo, ''Pandanus corallinus'' — ʻikai talatala *paongo, ''Pandanus whitmeeanus'' — ko e [[kakala ʻiloa]] *paufu *tapahina, ''Pandanus sp.'' — lau taʻetuhi *tofua, ''Pandanus corallinus'' — ʻoku ngāueʻaki ʻene lou mui ki he lalanga [[lōkeha]]; lau taʻetuhi *tutuʻila, ''Pandanus sp.'' — ʻikai talatala
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == *fala ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *balawa, vadra ([[lea fakafisi]]) **voivoi, ''Pandanus caricosus'' Rumph. *fara, hinano ([[lea fakatahisi]]) *ʻara ([[lea fakakuki]]) *hala ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) *fā ([[lea fakaniuē]])
== Toe meʻa kehe == Ko e fā ko e ʻakaū mahuʻinga taha hono ua ʻi he Pasifiki (ko e [[niu]] ko e ʻuluaki). Ko hono fua: meʻakai mo e ngaahi kahoa ([[papai fā]]); ko hono lou: fala.
== Tataku == *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler; ISBN 978-0-8248-1528-8 *Langi tauʻolunga & hiva kakala; Nukuʻalofa 2000; ISBN 978-982-9800-71-8 *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Hea
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[rosales]] |familia= [[ROSACEAE]] |genus=Parinari |species=insularum }} Ko e '''hea''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia. Ko e [[kakala ʻiloa]] ia, ko ʻene foʻi fua meimei tatau mo e ʻāpele. Mahalo pē ʻoku tatau ki he [[pipi]] ?
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *heavula, ''Syzygium richii'' (MYRTACEAE) mei he Myrtales, ʻoku namulelei, kae ko e ʻakau ʻomi, ʻa ia ʻoku ʻikai ha kakala *hēhea, ''Syzygium corynocarpus'' (MYRTACEAE), tatau mo e heavula *heamapa
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *seasea ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]), ''Syzygium corynocarpus'' *hea ([[lea fakaʻuvea]]) *sea ([[lea fakafutuna]])
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Koli
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[Myrtales]] |familia= [[MYRTACEAE]] |genus= Syzygium |species=neurocalyx |fakamoʻoniʻanga= A. Grey }} Ko e '''koli''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau ia mo e foʻi fua namulelei. Ko e [[kakala ʻiloa]] ia.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *kolitoto; foʻi fua kulokula *kolivai *kolivao pe [[kakalaʻuli]] pe tutuna, ''Diospyros samoensis'' A. Gray (EBENACEAE) mei he Ericales; vakai foki ki he [[olavai]]
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *kieto ([[lea fakaniuē]], ''Diospyros samoensis'') *fena, fena manogi, ʻoli ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) **ʻauʻauli, ''Diospyros samoensis'' *koli ([[lea fakaʻuvea]]) **tutuna (''Diospyros sp.'') *koli ([[lea fakafutuna]]) *tutunu (''Diospyros sp.'')
==Toe meʻa kehe== Ko e ʻapi ʻo [[Gustav Kronfeld]] (9 Eden crescent, Auckland NZ, ʻi he kamataʻanga ʻo teautaʻu hono 20; (ko e feituʻu ʻo e ʻunivesiti ʻo ʻAokalani he taimí ni)), naʻe ui ko e ʻoli-ula (kahoa koli).
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Fekika
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Malay apple |faitā= Jambosa domestica.jpg |faitālaulahi=246px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[myrtales]] |familia= [[MYRTACEAE]] |genus=Syzygium |species=malaccense |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= c }} [[File:Syzygium malaccense, flowers.jpg|left|320px|thumb|ko e fekika ʻi heʻene matala]] Ko e '''fekika''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau ia mo e foʻi fua ifo. ʻOku ui foki ko e ''Eugenia malaccensis'' pe ''Jambosa malaccensis''.
ʻOku ui ko e '''nonufiafia''' ʻi he talatupuʻa ʻo [[ʻAhoʻeitu]] ʻi he langi, ko e ʻakau faitoʻo ia.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * fekika, fekika kai; koʻeni * fekika tolahina; kanoʻi hinehina * fekika tolakula; kanoʻi kulamaama (ko e lanu ʻoku ui foki lanu-''fekika'') * [[fekika papālangi]] * [[fekika vao]] * fekika vai
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * kavika ([[lea fakafisi]]) * kafika ([[lea fakaʻuvea]], ''Syzygium clusiaefolium'') * ʻahiʻa ([[lea fakatahisi]]) * asi ([[lea fakafutuna]], ''Syzygium clusiaefolium'') * nonu fiʻafiʻa ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * kaʻika māori, kaʻika makatea, kaʻika tavake, kaʻika ʻenua ([[lea fakakuki]])
== Tataku == * http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6699 * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Mohokoi
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Ylangylang - Perfume tree |faitā= Cananga odorata 4.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[magnoliales]] |familia= [[ANNONACEAE]] |genus=Cananga |species=odorata |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Jean-Baptiste Lamarck|Lam.]]) [[Joseph Dalton Hooker|Hook.f.]] & [[Carl Gustaf Thomson|Thomson]] |fehokotaki= c }} Ko e '''mohokoi''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia, ʻe lava ʻo aʻu mita ʻe 15 pe lahi ange ʻi ʻolunga. Ko e [[kakala vale]] ia.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * Mohokoi Honolulu, ''Artabotrys unicatus'' (ANNONACEAE)
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * motoʻi ([[lea fakatahisi]]) * mosoʻoi ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * mokosoi ([[lea fakafisi]]) * mokoʻoi ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) * mataʻoi, motoʻoi ([[lea fakakuki]]) * mohokoi ([[lea faka'uvea]])
== Toe meʻa kehe == Ko e pōtea: Ko e lolo niu mo e namu ʻo e mohokoi.
== Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Huni
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |faitā=Phaleria disperma.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malvales]] |familia= [[THYMELAEACEAE]] |genus=Phaleria |species=disperma |fakamoʻoniʻanga= (Forst.f.) Baill. }} [[Image:Sitapa T$1 huni.jpg|left|thumb|200px|huni]] Ko e '''huni''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau ia, mita ʻe 2 pe 3 ʻi olunga, mo e matalaʻiʻakau iiki mo e hinehina. Ko e [[kakala vale]] ia.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *huni Tonga *huni ʻInitia *huni kautoto; ko e kau kulokula *huni kulukona; ko e [[kakala ʻiloa]] ia *huni tangitangi *huni vao, ''Ixora samoensis'' (RUBIACEAE) mei he Gentianales, Westindian jessamine *[[huni kula]]
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *suni ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) **filofiloa, ''Ixora samoensis'' **sunivao, ''Phaleria glabra''
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}} [[category:sitapa]]

page.title: Pipi
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |faitā=Parinarium glaberrimum-Atuna racemosa.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malpighiales]] |familia= [[CHRYSOBALANACEAE]] |genus=Parinarium |species=glaberrimum |fakamoʻoniʻanga=(Hassk.) [[Hasskarl|Hassk.]] }} Ko e '''pipi''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau ia mo e foʻi fua mo e tenga ʻoku manongi, sai ki he fai lolo. ʻOku ui foki ko e ''pipifailolo''. Ko e ʻuhinga tatau ko e ''Atuna racemosa'' Raf., ''Atuna elata'' (King) Kosterm., ''Atuna excelsa'' (Jack.) Kosterm., ''Cyclandrophora excelsa'' (Jack.) Kosterm., ''Parinari glaberrima'' Hassk., ''Parinarium laurinum'' A.Gray. He onoʻaho naʻe fakafaʻahingaʻi ʻa e pipi ʻi he fokotuʻunga ʻo e ''[[rosales]]'' kāinga ʻo e ''[[ROSACEAE|rosaceae]]''.
Ko e [[kakala ʻiloa]] ia. ʻOku ofi ki he [[hea]].
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *pipifailolo; koʻeni *pipifaisisi; sai maʻa e fai teunga faiva, (ʻikai ha kakala), tatau mo e pipitui (?) *pipitongi; tatau mo e pipifailolo (?) *pipitui, ''Hernandia moerenhoutiana'' (HERNANDIACEAE) mei he Laurales *[[pipivao]], ''Bryophyllum pinnatum'' (CRASSULACEAE)
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *ifiifi ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]), ''Atuna racemosa'' *atung, atun ([[lea fakaʻinitonisia]]) *pipi ([[lea fakafutuna]], [[lea fakahaʻamoa]]), ''Hernandia moerenhoutiana''
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Pipivao
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Air plant |faitā=Starr_031108-3187_Kalanchoe_pinnata.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[saxifragales]] |familia= [[CRASSULACEAE]] |genus=Kalanchoe |species=pinnata }} Ko e '''pipivao''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau ia. Naʻe ui foki ko e ''Bryophyllum calycinum'' pe ''Bryophyllum pinnatum''.
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == *ʻoliwa kū kahakai ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]], ʻolive tuʻu matātahi)
== Toe meʻa kehe == ʻOku tupu ʻa e ʻakau mui ʻi he ngataʻanga ʻo e lou motuʻa, pea nau tō, pea nau tupu ke lahi.
== Tataku == *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Kalosipani
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Frangipani |faitā= Plumeria alba 1.jpg |faitālaulahi=240px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[gentianales]] |familia= [[APOCYNACEAE]] |genus=Plumeria |species=alba |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Joseph Pitton de Tournefort|Tourn.]] ex [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} [[File:Plumeria-0-KayEss-1.jpeg|200px|left|thumb|''plumeria rubra'']] Ko e '''kalosipani''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia mo e ngaahi matalaʻiʻakau hinehina, engeenga, kiʻi kulokula pea kulokula ʻaupito. ʻOku namulelei, kae ko e ʻakau ʻomi, ko ia ai ʻoku ʻikai te ne kau ki he ngaahi kakala. ʻOku ui foki ko e '''[[pua]] (pālangi)'''.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * kalosipani, ''Plumeria alba'', ''Plumeria acuminata''; matalaʻiʻakau hinehina mo engeenga * kalosipani, ''Plumeria rubra'', ''Plumeria acutifolia''; matalaʻiʻakau kulokula mo fekika
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * pua ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) ** pua fiti, ''Plumeria rubra'' * melia ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) * te meria ([[lea fakakilipasi]])
== Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Multipurpose trees for agroforestry in the Pacific islands; R.R. Thaman, C.R. Elevitch, K.M. Wilkinson * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Pua
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Perfume tree |faitā= Fagraea berteriana (leaves, seeds).jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[gentianales]] |familia= [[LOGANIACEAE]] |genus=Fagraea |species=berteriana }} [[Image:Puakofanongotalanoa.jpg|right|thumb|350px|Pua ko fanongo talanoa, toe tō]] Ko e '''pua''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia mo e ngaahi matalaʻiʻakau engeenga mo namulelei. Ko e [[kakala vale]] ia. Taimi ʻe niʻihi ʻoku ui ko e ''F. berteroana'' pe ''Fragraea'' (sipelahalaʻi).
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *pua, pua tonga; ko ʻeni *pua, pua pālangi, ʻoku ui foki ko e [[kalosipani]]. *[[pua fisi]] *pua lotuma; ? *[[pualiki]] *[[pua engeenga]] *[[puataukanave]] *[[puopua]] *[[pua kalipea]]
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *pua ([[lea fakatahisi]], [[lea fakafutuna]]) *pualulu, puavao ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *pua keni keni ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]], pua seniti ''ten'' (hongofulu)) *bua ([[lea fakafisi]]) *puaʻuvea ([[lea fakaʻuvea]])
==Toe meʻa kehe== Ko e fuʻu pua ʻe taha ongoongoa, ko ''[[Pua ko fanongo talanoa]]'' ʻoku tuʻu ʻi [[Haʻavakatolo]].
==Tataku== *http://www.agroforestry.net/tti/Fagraea-puakenikeni.pdf *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Hawaiʻian dictionary; Elbert & Pukui *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Teʻepiloʻamaui
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |faitā= |faitālaulahi= |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[gentianales]] |familia= [[LOGANIACEAE]] |genus=Geniostoma |species=vitiense }} Ko e '''teʻepilo-ʻa-Maui''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau ia. ʻOku ui ko e ''teʻepilo'' koeʻuhi ʻene namukū.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *Teʻepiloʻamaui, ''Geniostoma vitiense'' *Teʻepiloʻamaui, ''Geniostoma rupestre''; matalaʻiʻakau hinehina
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *laumafatifati, taipoipo ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]], ''Geniostoma rupestre'' pe ''Geniostoma samoense'') *gahe ([[lea fakaʻuvea]]) *saugapilo ([[lea fakafutuna]])
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Puataukanave
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |faitā=Cordia subcordata, seeds, flower, leaves.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[lamiales]] |familia= [[BORAGINACEAE]] |genus=Cordia |species=subcordata |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Jean-Baptiste Lamarck|Lam.]] |fehokotaki= s }} [[File:Cordia subcordata, habitat.jpg|left|320px|thumb|Tupu ʻi he matātahi ʻo [[Manima]]]] [[File:Cordia subcordata, closeup.jpg|left|320px|thumb|Ko hono matalaʻiʻakau lanu momoho]] Ko e '''puataukanave''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau ia, aʻu ki he mita ʻe 10 ʻi ʻolunga, ʻoku ne tupu ofi ki he matātahi.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *puataukanave; koʻeni *puataukanave ''Maesa tongensis'' Mez
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *tauʻanave ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *nawanawana ([[lea fakafisi]]) *tou ([[lea fakatahisi]]) *kou ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) *motou ([[lea fakakuki]], [[lea fakaniuē]]) *kanava ([[lea fakaʻuvea]], [[lea fakafutuna]], [[lea fakatokelau]], [[lea fakatūvalu]]) *kanawa ([[lea fakakilibati]]) ko e [[tou]] fakatonga ko e ʻakau kehe
==Toe meʻa kehe== Ko e hotele lahi ʻi [[Neiafu]] ʻoku ui ''Hotele Puataukanave''.
==Tataku== *http://www.agroforestry.net/tti/Cordia-kou.pdf *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Tou
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |faitā= Pipturus argenteus tree.jpg |faitālaulahi= |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[rosales]] |familia= [[URTICACEAE]] |genus=Pipturus |species=argenteus |fakamoʻoniʻanga= (Forster f.) Wedd. }} [[Image:Pipturus argenteus flowers and foliage.jpg|thumb|left|upright=1.5|''Pipturus argenteus'']] Ko e '''tou''' pe '''ʻolongā''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau ia.
Mahalo pē ko hono hingoa ko ''Melochia odorata'' (Sterculiaceae) mei he Malvales.
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *fausogā ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]])
==Toe meʻa kehe== Ko e tamapua ko [[Tuʻitonganui Tamatou]] naʻe fai mei he ʻakau tou.
Ko ʻakau ʻo e tou ʻoku sai maʻa e pate kilikiti (foʻi tou).
ʻE lava fai ha maea mei he kili ʻo e tou, pe ha [[sisi vāloa]].
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Tongo
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Oriental / Brown mangrove |faitā= Bruguiera gymnorrhiza.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malpighiales]] |familia= [[RHIZOPHORACEAE]] |genus=Bruguiera |species=gymnorrhiza |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] }} Ko e '''tongo''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau ia, tupu ʻi he tahi.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * tongo, ''Bruguiera gymnorrhiza'', ''B. rheedii'', ''B. conjugata'' * tongo, [[tongolei]], tongo taʻane, ''Rhizophora sp.'' Kā ʻoku ʻi ai ha kakai ʻoku pehē ʻoku tatau ʻa e tongolei mo e ''Bruguiera'', pea ʻoku tatau ʻa e tongo mo e ''Rhizophora''.
ʻOku ʻikai pau ko e [[Fāʻonelua]] ʻoku tatau pe ofi pē ki he ''Bruguiera''.
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * togo ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * kukuna o ka lā ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]])
== Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler * Multipurpose trees for agroforestry in the Pacific islands; R.R. Thaman, C.R. Elevitch, K.M. Wilkinson * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Kape
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Giant taro |faitā= Alocasia macrorrhizos.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻitaha]] |ordo= [[alismatales]] |familia= [[ARACEAE]] |genus=Alocasia |species=macrorrhizos |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''kape''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau ia mo e ngaahi lou lahi ʻaupito (Telinga ʻelefānite). Hingoa motuʻa: ''A. macrorrhiza'', Bitter [[talo|taro]].
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == *kape hina *kape kula *kape talo *kape fuohenga **fuohenga engeenga **fuohenga ʻuli *kape fuotavahi *kape fuoʻuli *kape lauhoka *kape tuʻu
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == *kape ([[lea fakafutuna]], [[lea fakaniue]], [[lea faka'uvea]]) *ʻape ([[lea fakatahisi]], [[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) *taʻamū ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *[[babai]] ([[lea fakakilipasi]] {faʻahinga kehe})
== Toe meʻa kehe == Sai ki he kai, kapau naʻe fuoloa ʻene tuʻu ʻi he ʻumu.
== Tataku == *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward {{potuʻi}}

page.title: ʻUfilei
ʻUfi
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Purple yam |faitā= Dioscorea alata.jpg |faitālaulahi=300px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻitaha]] |ordo= [[dioscoreales]] |familia= [[DIOSCOREACEAE]] |genus=Dioscorea |species=alata |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] }} Ko e '''ʻufi''' ko e foʻi ʻakau ia, ko e meʻakai. Mahalo pē ʻoku sai ange: ko e taumafa.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * faha * falafala * hale * heketala ** heketala fisi ** heketala palau ** heketala puka ** heketala lōloa ** heketala hina ** heketala kula ** heketala vai * kafiu ** kafiu kula ** kafiu punailave * kahokaho; ko e tuʻi ʻo e ngaahi ʻufi ** kahokaho kulufau ** kahokaho hako ** kahokaho vai ** kahokaho tavake ** kahokaho siamane ** kahokaho tefau ** kahokaho ʻulumaka ** kahokaho muihina pe Kahokaho mulahina * kapakauʻikava ** kapakauʻikava muihina * kaumeile ** kaumeile hina ** kaumeile kula ** kaumeile punuluo ** kaumeile hako ** kaumeile puku ** kaumeile pekavalu ** kaumeile vaeʻikulī ** kaumeile toua ** kaumeile lautoka ** kaumeile ʻuli ** kaumeile ʻEua * keu * kivi ** kivi hina ** kivi kula ** kivi hako * koukau ** koukau hina ** koukau kula * kulo ** kulo hina ** kulo kula ** kulo hako ** kulo kau ** kulo matapoko * kulotua * laukoka * laumuli * lausi * lena ''Dioscorea pentaphylla'' * levei * lokoloka ** lokoloka hina ** lokoloka kula ** lokoloka mangavalu * māhoaʻa; ʻoku tatau ʻene ʻasi mo e [[māhoaʻa]] ** māhoaʻa puku ** māhoaʻa leleva * malau ** malau tuʻa ** malau melie * malekini * mamange ** mamange hina ** mamange kula * moala * natoto; louʻulu fio kulokula * nise * nuku * ngū ** ngū vaihina ** ngū vaikula ** ngū pakatā pe ngū tūpakatā ** ngū kafakafa ** ngū kiaʻimoa ** ngū puku * pāholo * palai; ko e ʻufi saisai pē ** palai tuʻakuku * palangi * palātea * poa ** poa hina ** poa kula * sikau ** sikau felefele ** sikau tūlalo * sikovata ** sikovata hoi ** sikovata fulufula * sivoli ** sivoli hina ** sivoli kula * solomone ** solomone hina ** solomone kula * taiakona * takulevu ** takulevu hina ** takulevu kula ** takulevu puku ** takulevu hako * tamuni ** tamuni hina ** tamuni kula ** tamuni keu * tapuane * tefau * [[teve]]; ko e ʻufi kovi pē * tua; ko e ʻufi saisai pē ** tua vai ** tua hina ** tua kula ** tua maka ** tua ʻata ** tua ʻatavai ** tua ʻatakafiu * vesivesi ** vesivesi hako ** vesivesi puku ** vesivesi felei ** vesivesi puhipuhi ** vesivesi hina ** vesivesi kula * voli ** voli hako ** voli hina ** voli kula ** voli leka * ʻufiʻufi ** ʻufiʻufi hina ** ʻufiʻufi kula ** ʻufiʻufi langakali ** ʻufiʻufi matanikali * ʻufi papālangi vakai foki ki he [[ʻufilei]].
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * ufi ([[lea fakatahisi]], [[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * uhi ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) * uvi ([[lea fakafisi]])
== Toe meʻa kehe == Ko e hingoa ʻo e ngaahi māhina tukufakaholo ʻo e taʻu ʻi Tonga onoʻaho, naʻa nau tupu mei he ngoue ʻufi.
Naʻe kole ʻe [[Tuʻitātui]] ʻa e pulopula maʻa hono ngoue. Naʻe ʻa e heliaki ia maʻa [[Nua]].
== Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Vaohoi Kona Naufahu (Vaea Tupou)
Lesi
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Papaya |faitā=Papayabaum.jpg |faitālaulahi=302px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[brassicales]] |familia= [[CARICACEAE]] |genus=Carica |species=papaya |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''lesi''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau ia mo haʻane foʻi fua lahi mo ifo.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * lesi fuololoa * lesi fuopupuku * lesi vao, ''Coronopus didymus'' (CRUCIFEREA pe BRASSICACEAE); ko e fuʻu ʻakau tatau ʻene ʻasi, kā hono lahi ʻoku siʻisiʻi ange
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * ʻesi ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * ngingitā ([[lea fakakuki]]) * ʻiʻitā ([[lea fakatahisi]]) * mīkana, milikana, hēʻī, papaia ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]])
== Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Multipurpose trees for agroforestry in the Pacific islands; R.R. Thaman, C.R. Elevitch, K.M. Wilkinson {{potuʻi}}

{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Avocado pear |faitā= Persea americana fruits.JPG |faitālaulahi=341px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[laurales]] |familia= [[LAURACEAE]] |genus=Persea |species=americana |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Philip Miller|Mill.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''ʻāvoka''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia mo hono foʻi fua lahi mo ifo.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * ʻāvoka hina * ʻāvoka kula

page.title: Moʻonia
Hangale
Telie
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Tropical almond |faitā= Terminalia catappa fruits.JPG |faitālaulahi=280px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[myrtales]] |familia= [[COMBRETACEAE]] |genus=Terminalia |species=catappa |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= c }} [[File:Terminalia catappa, banches.jpg|left|400px|thumb|ko e fuʻu telie mui, tokanga ki he ngaahi manga ʻoku tupu fakalava]] [[File:Terminalia catappa, stages.jpg|left|400px|thumb|Fuʻu telie ʻe 4 ʻi he ngaahi hokohoko failau kehekehe]] Ko e '''telie''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau ia, mo e ʻakau kula mo fefeka ʻaupito.
ʻOku taha pē ʻo e ngaahi ʻakau siʻisiʻi ʻi Tongá ni ʻoku nau fakatō fakataʻu ʻenau lau kotoa. ʻI Tongá ni ʻoku tō ʻa e ngaahi lau ʻi Siulai, pea ʻoku tupu ʻa e ngaahi lau foʻou ʻi Sēpitema. Kā ʻoku ʻikai ʻi he taimi tatau ki he ngaahi fuʻu kotoa. Mahalo pē ʻaho ʻe taha ʻoku kamata failau foʻou ʻe he fuʻu ʻe taha lolotonga kei tō ʻa e lau motuʻa ʻe he fuʻu ʻe taha.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * telie lalikē * telie ʻa manu, ''Terminalia litoralis'' pe ''Terminalia samoensis'' * telie pālangi, ʻapu, ''Anacardium occidentale'', Cashewnut
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * selie ([[lea fakaniuē]]) * talie ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) ** malili, ''Terminalia richii'' * kauariki, kaukauariki, kavariki ([[lea fakakuki]]) * Autaraʻa ([[lea fakatahisi]], ''Terminalia glabrata'' he onoʻaho) * kamani haole ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]], ''kamani'' loi, fakatatauʻi [[fetaʻu]]) * tavola ([[lea fakafisi]])
== Toe meʻa kehe == {{kananga|tuʻamelie ki he fuʻu telie}} == Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Fetaʻu
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Portia, Bali nut, Alexandrian laurel, Beach mahogany |faitā= Calophyllum-inophyllum05.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malpighiales]] |familia= [[CLUSIACEAE]] |genus=Calophyllum |species= inophyllum |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= c }} [[File:Calophyllum-inophyllum03.jpg|left|thumb|320px|matala]] Ko e '''fetaʻu''' pe '''tamanu''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia, mo e ʻakau kula mo fefeka. Ko ʻene ngaahi foʻi fua ʻoku ʻikai lelei ki he kai, kā ʻoku ʻi ai ha lolo faitoʻo ʻi loto. ʻOku meimei tatau ʻenau ʻasi mo e [[tuitui]] kā ʻoku kehe ʻa e ngaahi lau.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == *tamanu; ko e ʻuhinga tatau mo ʻeni *tamanu ''Calophyllum vitiensis'' (ʻI Tahisi: ''Calophyllum tacamahaca''); fuʻu ʻakau meimei tatau; tātātaha *tamanu; vakai foki ki he [[pekepeka]] *fetaʻu; koʻeni *fetaʻu; ko e faʻahinga [[fusi|hopa]] foki ia.
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == *fetau ([[lea fakaniuē]]) *fetau ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *tamanu ([[lea fakakuki]]) *tamanu ([[lea fakafutuna]] ''Calophyllum neo-ebudicum'') *ʻati, tamanu ([[lea fakatahisi]]) *kamani ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) *dilo ([[lea fakafisi]]) **damanu, ''Callophylum Burmani'' *te itai ([[lea fakakilipasi]])
== Tataku == *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 *Multipurpose trees for agroforestry in the Pacific islands; R.R. Thaman, C.R. Elevitch, K.M. Wilkinson {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Futu
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Fishpoison tree, Boxfruit |faitā= Barringtonia asiatica (flower).jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[ericales]] |familia= [[LECYTHIDACEAE]] |tribus= [[PLANCHONIOIDEAE]] (=BARRINGTONIACEAE) |genus=Barringtonia |species=asiatica }} [[File:Barringtonia asiatica (seed).jpg|left|300px|thumb|foʻi tenga]] Ko e '''futu''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia. ʻOku lahi mo tapafā hono foʻi tenga, ʻoku ngāueʻaki maʻa e ʻaukava.
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * futu ([[lea fakaniuē]]) * futu ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) ** falaga (''Barringtonia samoensis'') * ʻutu ([[lea fakakuki]]) * hotu ([[lea fakatahisi]], ''hutu'' he onoʻaho) * vutu ([[lea fakafisi]])
== Toe meʻa kehe == Ko [[Futu-ko-Vuna]] ko e hingoa ia ʻo e futu lahi ʻi lotoʻā [[Siasi Katolika Loma]] ʻi [[Lapaha]] fehāngaaki [[ʻAhofakasiu]]. Naʻe tauhingoa kia [[Vuna Takitakimālohi]], ko e heliaki ia ki he [[:Category:Tuʻi Tonga|Tuʻi Tonga]]. ʻOku pulia he taimí ni.
== Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler * Multipurpose trees for agroforestry in the Pacific islands; R.R. Thaman, C.R. Elevitch, K.M. Wilkinson {{potuʻi}}

page.title: ʻolive
page.text: #REDIRECT[[ʻOlive]]

page.title: ʻOlive
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Mock orange, Orange jessamine |faitā=Murraya paniculata.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[sapindales]] |familia= [[RUTACEAE]] |genus=Murraya |species= paniculata |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]]) Jack |fehokotaki= c }} [[File:Murraya paniculata fruits.JPG|left|thumb|foʻi fua]] Ko e '''ʻolive''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia mo e lahi ngaahi lou siʻi, kiʻi matalaʻiʻakau hinehina pe amo e foʻi fua lanumoli. Ko ʻene ngāueʻaki mahuʻinga taha maʻa e ngaahi [[sisi]] ʻi he teunga faiva. ʻOku tatau mo e ''Chalcas paniculata'' pe ''Murraya exotica''.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * ʻolive, ʻolive fī sisi; ko e ʻakau ʻeni * [[mavaetangi]], ''Duranta erecta'', ʻoku ui ko e ʻolive ʻe Yunker taʻetotonu * ʻolive kai, ''Olea europaea'' (OLEACEAE); ko e ʻolive moʻoni tupuʻanga ʻo e lolo ʻolive
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * tiare ‘ānani ([[lea fakatahisi]], [[lea fakakuki]])
== Tataku == * http://www.hear.org/pier/species/murraya_paniculata.htm * http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6411 * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Arboreal biodiversity as foundation for sustainable development in Tonga; R.R. Thaman. (Polynesian paradox ISBN 982-02-0371-6 * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Felila
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Bougainvillea |faitā=Bougainvillea glabra.JPG |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[caryophyllales]] |familia= [[NYCTAGINACEAE]] |genus=Bougainvillea |species=spectabilis |fakamoʻoniʻanga= Willd. |fehokotaki= c }} [[File:Bougainvillea-Flowers-KayEss-1.jpeg|right|thumb|200px]] Ko e '''felila''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia mo e matalaʻiʻakau kulokula pe lanufelila, pea mo e talatala masila. ʻOku ui foki ko e ''Bougainvillea glabra''.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * talatalaʻāmoa, ''Caesalpinia bonduc'' pe ''Caesalpinia crista'' (FABACEAE), Gray nickers; ʻoku meimei tatau ʻene ʻasi mo e felila
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * pukanavila ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]])
== Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Siale tafa
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |faitā=Bikkia tetrandra.jpg |name=Coastal gardenia |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[gentianales]] |familia= [[RUBIACEAE]] |genus=Bikkia |species=tetrandra }} Ko e '''siale tafa''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia. Ko e [[kakala vale]] ia. ʻOku tupu ʻi he liku.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *[[siale tonga]] *[[siale matalateau]] *[[siale mohemohe]]
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *siale tofa ([[lea fakaniuē]]) *nānū, nāʻū ([[lea fakahauaʻi]]) (?)
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler; ISBN 978-0-8248-1528-8 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Siale Tonga
