page.title: Vaimalō/en
page.text:
'''Vaimalō''' is a village in the western district of Vavaʻu. Before the passage of the Vavaʻu Land Acts (V.L.A) of 1881 and 1914 that effectively placed Vaimalō under government control, the whole of Vaimalō was the single residential estate of Naufahu Mapilitoa and his family. Naufahu Mapilitoa was the only child of Luseane ʻI-fanga-Hihifo to Finau Fisi. Upon Naufahu Mapilitoaʻs passing, Vaimalō became home to his only son [[Avalaʻaetau Mapilitoa Naufahu]], who was espoused to ʻAlilia Funakitoutai and had 4 children by her;
# Tevita Taʻofi-kae-tau Tapueluelu # Lesieli Afu Haʻapai # Lavinia Sialehaehae # Salesi Mataele-ʻo-Haʻamea.
When the V.L.A went into effect in 1881, His Majesty Siaosi Taufaʻahau Tupou I cleverly persuaded countless minor lords or “ʻEiki siʻisiʻi” of Vavaʻu whose land the government took over, to abide with the new V.L.A by appointing them to various government positions with fancy titles. Such was His Majesty's appointment of [[Tevita Taʻofikaetau Tapueluelu]] to become the first Mayor of the bustling new town of [[Neiafu]]. This appointment is viewed by many as a clever measure to appease a very influential and sometimes unruly Tapueluelu. The prestigious position and title with its implied significance did just that, Tapueluelu permanently moved out of Vaimalō and made Neiafu his new home. Tapuelueluʻs new position and title came with a hereditary estate with His Majestyʻs blessing that Tevita named Sailoame. Tevita was not the only child of Avala-ʻae-tau to move out of Vaimalō, earlier in 1878, [[Lesieli Afuhaʻapai]] married [[Siaosi ʻUlukivaiola Tuita]] who was the 6th Tuita, and made [[ʻUtungake]], Vavaʻu her new home.
When the two eldest children of Avala-ʻae-tau moved out of Vaimalō, the two remaining; Lavinia Sialehaehae and Salesi Matele-ʻo-Haʻamea decided to divide Vaimalō into two separate residents for themselves. Lavinia Sialehaehae made the whole oceanfront part of Vaimalō her home and named it MUILELEU. Salesi Mataele-ʻo-Haʻamea took over the inland part of Vaimalō and named his home MOHE-MO-LANGA.
Lavinia Sialehaehae was barren and didnʻt have any children so upon her passing, Salesi Mataele-ʻo-Haʻamea became the sole “hereditary occupant” of Vaimalō. Soon thereafter, he decided to give up his home of Mohe-mo-langa to a relative and move in to Laviniaʻs oceanfront home of Muileleu. Salesi married another Lavinia, this time a daughter of Kolotesi from [[Foa|Faleloa]], Haʻapai. They had one child, a son they named Salesi Kato-ki-moʻunga Tuʻipulotu whose grandchildren are the current occupants of Muileleu, Mohe-mo-langa, and most of Vaimalō today.
Vaimalō's current general population is made up mainly of Salesi Mataele-ʻo-Haʻameaʻs family, close relatives, remnants of invited relatives and friends from [[Niuē]], [[Haʻamoa|Sāmoa]], [[Fisi|Fiji]], and the Solomons.
Vaimalōʻs nickname is Funga Mapitoa. Mapitoa is a massive rock formation that sticks out of the ocean and is only five meters or so away from the tail end of Vaimalōʻs landmass right in front of Muileleu. The rock formation was so named “Mapitoa”, short for “Mapilitoa” by His Majesty [[Siaosi Tupou I|Siaosi Tāufaʻāhau Tupou I]], as a tribute to Vaimalōʻs original renowned resident Naufahu Mapilitoa. {{Foki||Vaimalō}}

page.title: Pualiki
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Whitey-wood |faitā=Melicytusramiflorus.jpg |faitālaulahi= 240px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malpighiales]] |familia= [[VIOLACEAE]] |genus=Melicytus |species=samoensis |fakamoʻoniʻanga= Christophersen }} Ko e '''pualiki''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia. ʻOku tupu pē ʻi [[ʻEua]], ʻoku lahi ʻi [[Nuʻusila]]. ʻOku kehe ʻaupito mo e [[pua]].
ʻOku ʻikai te ne tatau mo e ''Melicytus ramiflorus'', naʻe tui ki ai ʻi he kuonga kuo hili. He taimí ni ʻoku pehē ʻe he kau saienisi ko ''M. oblongifolius'' mei [[Norfolk Island]] pea mo e ''M. fastigiatus'' mei [[Fisi]] pea mo e ''M. samoensis'' mei [[Haʻamoa]] mo Tonga, ʻoku ʻikai te nau kei kau ki he ''M. ramiflorus'' mei [[Nuʻusila]], kā ko e ngaahi faʻahinga kehe moʻoni.
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == *māhoe ([[lea fakamauli]])
== Tataku == *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 *D.R. Drake, Rain forest vegetation of ʻEua Island, New Zealand Journal of Botany '''34''', 1996 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Pua fisi
Huni kula
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Flame of the forest |faitā=Ixora chinensis 1.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[gentianales]] |familia= [[RUBIACEAE]] |genus=Ixora |species=coccinea |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= c }} [[Image:Ixora coccinea, yellow.jpg|left|320px|thumb|huni <s>kula</s> enga]] [[Image:Ixora coccinea, white.jpg|left|320px|thumb|huni <s>kula</s> tea]] Ko e '''huni kula''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau ia, mita ʻe 2 ʻi olunga, mo e matalaʻiʻakau iiki mo e kulokula. ʻOku meimei tatau ʻene ʻasi mo e [[huni]], kā ko e faʻahinga ʻakau kehe ʻaupito. Ko e ʻakau foʻou mo e ʻomi ia, kā ʻoku manakoa ʻi he ngaahi ngoue ʻapi kolo. ʻOku lahi hono ngaahi fuo mo e matalaʻiʻakau lanu kehekehe.
Mahalo pē ʻoku tatau ia mo e ''Ixora chinensis'' pe ''Ixora casei''.
Ko e fuʻu ʻakau mo hono matalaʻiʻakau hinehina, ko e '''huni tea''', ʻoku ʻi ai ʻa e faʻahinga mo hono lauʻimatala loloa ange mo e lausiʻi ange, ko e ''Ixora finlaysoniana'' [[Wall.]] ex [[G. Don]].
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Talupite ʻangelo
Tāupoʻou
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Asparagus fern |faitā=Asparagus plumosus.JPG |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻitaha]] |ordo= [[asparagales]] |familia= [[ASPARAGACEAE]] |genus=Asparagus |species=plumosus |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[John Gilbert Baker|Baker]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''tāupoʻou''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia, ko e ʻakau matala neongo ʻene ʻasi he [[kulutuma]] pe ko e hā.
ʻOku ʻikai te ne tatau mo e [[ʻuluʻitāupoʻou]], ko e [[ʻakau tengaefuefu]], kā mahalo pē naʻe hala ʻa e kakai.
Naʻa ne kau ki he LILIACEAE ʻi he taimi kuo hili. Naʻe ui foki ko e ''Protasparagus plumosus'', ''Protasparagus setaceus''. ʻOku tatau foki ʻene ʻasi mo hono hingoa ki he ''A. setaceus'' pe ''Asparagopsis setacea'', ka ki he kau saienisi ko e faʻahinga kehe ia; ʻoku ʻikai ʻene talatala peku ʻi hono sino.
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *remu ([[lea fakakuki]], ''A. setaceus'') *lau liliʻi ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]], ''A. plumosus'')
==Tataku== *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/asparagus_plumosus.htm *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/asparagus_setaceus.htm *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Hefa
Vaine fakafulutāmakiaʻi/en
Vaine fakafulutāmakiaʻi
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Scarlet gourd, Ivy gourd |faitā=Coccinia grandis fruit.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[cucurbitales]] |familia= [[CUCURBITACEAE]] |genus=Coccinia |species=grandis |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]]) Voigt |fehokotaki= c }} [[Image:Coccinia grandis Cocos nucifera.jpg|left|thumb|150px|Ko siʻi fuʻu niu ʻoku fakafulutāmakiaʻi ʻe he vaine]] [[Image:Starr_050222-4132_Coccinia_grandis.jpg|right|thumb|150px]] Ko e '''vaine fakafulutāmakiaʻi''' (hingoa taʻefakalakanga) ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia. ʻOku ʻakau ʻomi mei [[ʻEsia]] hahake, ʻoku fakaaoao ʻaupito, ʻoku ne fakafulutāmakiaʻi ʻa e ʻakau kehe, ʻufiʻufi ʻa e ngaahi pu ʻuhila moe hā fua. ʻOku tatau ʻene ʻasi mo e [[vaine]], kā ko e kāinga mo e fokotuʻunga kehe, ko e kāinga ʻo e [[kiukamipā|kiukamipaá]]. ʻOku tatau mo e ''C. cordifolia''.
ʻOku lava ke kai ʻa e foʻi fua (kei lanumata pe momoho ʻi he kulokula ʻaupito), tatau mo e kiukamipā. Ko e ''tindora'' ia ʻi he peito [[ʻInitia]].
ʻOku lahi ʻene tupu ʻi [[:Category:Tongatapu & takatakai|Tongatapu]], kā teʻeki aʻu ki [[:Category:Vavaʻu|Vavaʻu]] e taimí ni.
==Tataku== *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/coccinia_grandis.htm {{potuʻi}} {{English|abstract}}

page.title: Lile
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Spider lily, Asiatic poisonbulb |faitā=Crinum asiaticum 2.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻitaha]] |ordo= [[asparagales]] |familia= [[AMARYLLIDACEAE]] |genus=Crinum |species=asiaticum |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Hannibal]] 1972 |fehokotaki= cs }} [[Image:Crinum xanthophyllum.jpg|left|320px|thumb|samoa]] Ko e '''lile''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia. ʻOku meimei tatau mo e ''Crinum pedunculatum'', [Swamp lily]. Mahalo pē ko e faʻahinga kehe ia, pe ko faʻahinga kiʻi kehe pē: ''Crinum asiaticum'' var. ''pedunculatum''. Ko e ngaahi lou matala ʻo e ''C. pedunculatum'' ʻoku nounou ange kā laulahi ange.
Ko e foha ʻo e lile kotoa ʻoku fakamate ʻaupito.<br clear="left" />
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *'''lile loulanumata''' pe '''tolotalo''', ''Crinum asiaticum''; lou lanumata pē, lahi matalaʻiʻakau ʻi he pupunga ʻe taha *'''lile louengeenga''' pe '''samoa''', ''Crinum xanthophyllum'', [Golden spider lily]; lou lanumata mo e engeenga, siʻi ange ngaahi matalaʻiʻakau ʻi he pupunga ʻe taha *[[lile lalahi]], oku tatau ʻene ʻasi mo e ongo lile heni, ka ʻoku kulokula ange pea oku lalahi ange. *[[lile kalukalu]] *[[lile veʻemoa]] *[[lile pilisipeni]] *[[lile kula]] *[[lile lēpati]]
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *lili ([[lea fakaniuē]]) *eriri ([[lea fakatahisi]]) *lautalotalo ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *te luhe ([[lea fakatūvalu]]) *riri ([[lea fakakuki]]) *lautalotalo, viavia ([[lea fakafisi]])
==Tataku== *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/crinum_asiaticum.htm *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=5988 tolotalo *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=14105 samoa *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Ikuʻikumā
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Vervain, Blue rat's tail |faitā=Stachytarpheta cayennensis.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[lamiales]] |familia= [[VERBENACEAE]] |genus=Stachytarpheta |species=cayennensis |fakamoʻoniʻanga= (Rich.) Vahl, |fehokotaki= s }} Ko e '''ikuʻikumā''' pe '''hikuʻikumā''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia, mo e kiʻi matalaʻiʻakau lanupulū. Ko e ʻuhinga tatau ko e ''Stachytarpheta urticaefolia'', kā ko e hingoa onoʻaho ko e ''S. urticifolia'' pe ''S. dichotoma''. ʻOku tatau pe ʻikai mo e ikuʻikumā lanumata ?
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *ikuʻikumā lanumata, fisi lanumata, ''S. indica''. ʻOku ui ko e ''ʻakau kovi ʻoku mafola mo tupu vao'' ʻe he [[:Category:palemia ʻo Tonga|palemia]] ʻo Tonga ʻi 1933 (lao fakalahi 1988, vahe 128) maʻa hono kātoa ʻo Tonga.
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *mautofu, motofu Samoa ([[lea fakaniuē]]) *mautofu fualanumoana, mautofu tala, mautofu tai, mautofu vao ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *tiāki ([[lea fakakuki]]) *lavenia, se karakarawa, serakawa, tubutubu, turulakaka ([[lea fakafisi]])
==Tataku== *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/stachytarpheta_cayennensis.htm *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 *D.R. Drake, Rain forest vegetation of ʻEua Island, New Zealand Journal of Botany '''34''', 1996 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Tēvunga muli
Tēvunga
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Red ginger |faitā=Alpinia purpurata01.jpg |faitālaulahi= 250px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻitaha]] |ordo= [[zingiberales]] |familia= [[ZINGIBERACEAE]] |genus=Alpinia |species=purpurata |fakamoʻoniʻanga= (Vieill.) [[Karl Moritz Schumann|K.Schum.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''tēvunga''' pe '''teuila''' pe '''sinisā kulokula''', ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia. ʻI he ngaahi fonua lahi taha ʻo [[Polinisia]] ʻoku pehē ʻe he kakai ʻoku tatau ko e tēvunga mo e teuila. Kā ʻosi he fakakaukau, ʻoku ʻi ai ʻa e '''tēvunga kula''' mo e '''tēvunga tea'''. ʻOku tatau (moʻoni pe ʻene ʻasi pē) mo e ''Etlingera cevuga'' (Seem.) R.M. Sm., (waxflower) = ''Amomum cevuga'' = (sipelahalaʻi) ''Amonum cevuga'' (ZINGIBERACEAE).
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * tēvunga = tēvunga kula; koʻeni * [[teuila]] = tēvunga tea * [[tēvunga muli]]; matalaʻiʻakau fuʻu lahi ange * [[sinisā]]; (ka ko e ngaahi sinisā moʻoni ko e kāinga ofi kehe kinautolu) vakai foki ki he [[ango]]
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * kamapui futi kula ([[lea fakaniuē]]) * ʻōpuhi, ʻōpuhi ʻuteʻute ([[lea fakatahisi]], ''Amomum cevuga'') * ʻawapuhi ʻulaʻula ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) * teuila ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * kāopi kura, kāopi muramura, kaopui kutekute ([[lea fakakuki]]) * cevuga ([[lea fakafisi]])
== Tataku == * http://www.hear.org/pier/species/alpinia_purpurata.htm * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Teuila
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=White ginger, Butterfly ginger |faitā=Hedychium coronarium1.jpg |faitālaulahi= 250px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻitaha]] |ordo= [[zingiberales]] |familia= [[ZINGIBERACEAE]] |genus=Hedychium |species=coronarium |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Johann Gerhard König|J.König]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''teuila''' pe '''tēvunga''', ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia. ʻI he ngaahi fonua lahi taha ʻo [[Polinisia]] ʻoku pehē ʻe he kakai ʻoku tatau ko e teuila mo e tēvunga. Kā ʻosi he fakakaukau, ʻoku ʻi ai ʻa e '''teuila tea''' mo e '''teuila kula'''.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * teuila = teuila tea; koʻeni * [[tēvunga]] = teuila kula * [[misimisi]]; meimei tatau ʻene ʻasi, matalaʻiʻakau kulokula pe engeenga
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * ʻōpuhi, ʻōpuhi tea ([[lea fakatahisi]], ''Amomum cevuga''(?)) * ʻawapuhi keʻokeʻo ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) * teuila, teuila paepae ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * kōpī, kōpī teatea, kaopui teatea, reʻa, reʻa teatea ([[lea fakakuki]]) * cevuga, cevuga vula, dalasika, drove ([[lea fakafisi]])
== Tataku == * http://www.hear.org/pier/species/hedychium_coronarium.htm * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Misimisi
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Canna, Indian shot |faitā=Canna indica (wild species) flowers.JPG |faitālaulahi= 240px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻitaha]] |ordo= [[zingiberales]] |familia= [[CANNACEAE]] |genus=Canna |species=indica |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] }} [[File:Canna indica (wild species) seeds.JPG|left|240px|thumb|ʻū tenga]] Ko e '''misimisi''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia mo e matalaʻiʻakau engeenga pe kulokula. Ko ʻene ʻū tenga ʻoku ʻuliʻuli mo e mamafa mo e fefeka, ʻenau ʻasi ʻoku tatau mo e ngaahi foʻi pulukōkō. ʻA ia ko e hingoa [[Polinisia]] ko e '''fana-manu''', pe ʻa e hingoa [[fakapilitānia]] ''Indian shot''.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * misimisi kokaʻanga, ''Maranta arundinacea'' (MARANTACEAE), arrowroot, obedience plant; lou lanu-ua * misimisi ʻa e pulu = fanamanu; mahalo pē maʻa e ngaahi tenga pē ? * misimisi papālangi; ''Iris sp.'' (IRIDACEAE) * [[teuila]]; ʻoku kehe, kā meimei tatau ʻene ʻasi
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * pia-rarotoʻa, reʻa-puaʻaniho ([[lea fakatahisi]]) * aliʻipoe, poloka ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) * fagafaga ([[lea fakafutuna)]] * fa‘i masoa, fagamanu, fanamanu ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * nūāenga, pia-renga, tiare-papaʻā ([[lea fakakuki]]) * gasau ni ga ([[lea fakafisi]])
== Tataku == * http://www.hear.org/pier/species/canna_indica.htm * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Fuetahi
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Beach morning glory, Goat's foot |faitā=Ipomoea pes-caprae 3.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[solanales]] |familia= [[CONVOLVULACEAE]] |genus=Ipomoea |species=pes-caprae |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]]) [[Robert Brown|R.Br.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''fuetahi''' pe '''fuekula''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia. ʻOku lahi ʻene tupu ʻi he matātahi. ʻOku ui foki ko e ''I. brasiliensis'' pe ''I. pes-caprae'' var ''brasiliensis''.
Tatau mo e ngaahi fue kehe, kapau te ke fiesio ki hono matalaʻiʻakau, ʻe sai te ke ʻalu ʻi hengihengi. ʻOku ne maheikau he efiafi. (Ko e liliu ʻo hono hingoa [[lea fakapilitānia]]: Sani pongipongi [ʻi he] matātahi.)
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == vakai ki he [[fue]] maʻa e lahi ngaahi fue kehe
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * pōhue, pōhue miti ([[lea fakatahisi]]) * pōhuehue ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) * fue moa, fue vili ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * kākā, pōʻue, pōhue ([[lea fakakuki]]) ** kākā pae-tai ([[Mangaia]]) ** raupohue, raupohue tarona (ʻotumotu Kuki tokelau) * wa vulavula, lawere ([[lea fakafisi]])
== Tataku == * http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6274 * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler; ISBN 978-0-8248-1528-8 * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Fuehina
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Beach moonflower |faitā=Ipomoea macrantha.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[solanales]] |familia= [[CONVOLVULACEAE]] |genus=Ipomoea |species=macrantha |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= s }}{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=White clockvine |faitā=Thunbergia fragrans.jpg |faitālaulahi= 280px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[lamiales]] |familia= [[ACANTHACEAE]] |genus=Thunbergia |species=fragrans |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[William Roxburgh|Roxb.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''fuehina''' pe '''fuelalahi''' (''Ipomoea'') ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi mo e totolo ia. ʻOku lahi ʻene tupu ʻi he matātahi. Tatau mo e ngaahi kehe, kapau te ke fiesio ki hono matalaʻiʻakau, ʻe sai te ke ʻalu ʻi hengihengi, ʻoku ne matala ʻi he pō (taimi ʻo e ulo māhina, ʻa ia hono hingoa [[lea fakapilitānia]]). Ko e matalaʻiʻakau lahi mo e hinehina.
Ko e '''fuehina''' (''Thunbergia'') ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi foki ia, ʻoku siʻi ange hano matalaʻiʻakau, kae ʻoku lahi ʻene tupu he taimí ni ʻi Tongá ni, ko e vao ia. Ko e ʻakau ʻomi pē ia, ʻoku foʻou hono hingoa, ʻoku teʻeki fakahingoaʻi ʻi he ngaahi kaungāfonua.
ʻOku tatau ʻa e fuelalahi mo e ''I. tuba'', mo e ''Convolvulus tuba'', mo e ''I. grandiflora'', pea mo e ''I. violacea''. Kā ʻoku pehē ʻe he kau saienisi ʻe taha ko e faʻahinga kehe ko e ''I. violacea'', (ko hono matalaʻiʻakau ʻoku lanu-fisiʻifekika, ʻikai hinehina). ʻOku ui foki (''I. violacea'') ko e '''pula''' (kā ʻoku ʻi ai foki ha [[pula]] kehe).
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *[[fue]]; vakai ki hē maʻa lahi ngaahi fue kehe *fuehina; koʻeni *fuehina ''I. tiliacea''
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *fuesea, fuetea ([[lea fakaniuē]]) *pōʻue, laupōuwe, pōhue sina, kākā ([[lea fakakuki]]) *pōhue, pōhue motu ([[lea fakatahisi]]) *fue itulā ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *tobici, wa ika ([[lea fakafisi]])
==Tataku== *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/ipomoea_violacea.htm *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/thunbergia_fragrans.htm *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6272 *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler; ISBN 978-0-8248-1528-8 *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Fue
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Coastal morning-glory, Whiteflower beach morning-glory |faitā= |faitālaulahi= 320px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[solanales]] |familia= [[CONVOLVULACEAE]] |genus=Ipomoea |species=gracilis |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Robert Brown|R.Br.]] |fehokotaki= s }} Ko e '''fue''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi mo e totolo ia. ʻOku ʻi ai lahi ngaahi fue kehekehe, kā ko e ʻakaú ni, ʻoku ui ''fue'' pē. ʻOku ui foki ko e ''Ipomoea littoralis'' (L.) Blume pe ''Convolvulus littoralis'' pe ''I. forsteri'' pe ''I. denticulata''. ʻOku kulamaama ʻa e matalaʻiʻakau.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * fue; koʻeni * [[fuetahi]] pe fuekula * [[fuehina]] pe fuelalahi * fuetea; tatau mo e fuehina pe ''I. alba'' ? * [[fueʻaepuaka]], pe fuefakahinga * [[fuekulaʻahoʻaho]] * [[fuevao]] * [[fuemoa]] * [[lautolu|fue veveli pe fuetahi veveli]] * fuefue * fuekona * fuepulahina * [[fuepulupulutuʻi]] * [[fuemea]] * fueʻuta, ''Phaseolus adenanthus'' pe ''Vigna adenantha'' (FABACEAE) * fuesiaina, maileminiti, ''Mikania micrantha'' (CONVOLVULACEAE) * [[maileminiti]] * pula vaine, ''Stictocardia tiliifolia'' (CONVOLVULACEAE), pālulu ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * fue paipa holani, ''Aristolochia elegans'' * fuefailolo, ''Piper'' sp.; tupu ʻi [[Niuatoputapu]] pē * tupu ʻi Tonga, kae ʻikai hano hingoa ** ''Merremia dissecta'' ** ''Ipomoea alba'' ** ''Operculina turpethum'' = ''I. turpethum''
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * tefifi ([[lea fakaniuē]]) * pāpati ([[lea fakatahisi]]) * pipi, pāpati ([[lea fakakuki]]) * pālulu ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) ** lau tagamimi (''I. littoralis'') ** fue vao, fue lautetele (fuemea)
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == {{kananga|Muʻomuʻa puke fue}}ko e tokotaha ʻoku siokita. == Tataku == * http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6271 * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler; ISBN 978-0-8248-1528-8 * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Mavaetangi
Moʻota
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[sapindales]] |familia= [[MELIACEAE]] |genus=Dysoxylum |species=forsteri |fakamoʻoniʻanga= (Jussieu) C.DC. }} Ko e '''moʻota''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *moʻota ʻuta, moʻota hina; koʻeni, ʻoku ui foki ko e ''D. richii'' *moʻota mea, moʻota kula, ''D. tongense''; tupu ʻi ʻEua pē, ʻi moʻunga pē, kā ʻoku lahi.
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *maota, mamala ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *maota ([[lea fakaʻuvea]], [[lea fakafutuna]], ''D. samoense'')
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 *D.R. Drake et al., Rain forest vegetation of ʻEua Island, New Zealand Journal of Botany '''34''', 1996 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Fisihina
Vavae
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Kapok |faitā=Kapok tree-pod.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malvales]] |familia= [[MALVACEAE]] |subfamilia= bombacoideae |genus=Ceiba |species=pentandra |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]]) [[Joseph Gaertner|Gaertn.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} [[File:Ceiba pentandra.jpg|left|240px|thumb|ʻOku tutue ʻa e falengā fuʻu ʻakau Tonga]] Ko e '''vavae''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia. He onoʻaho naʻe kau ki he BOMBACACEAE. ʻOsi ʻomi ʻe he kau papālangi ʻo e vavae lelei ange ['cotton'] ʻoku ngāueʻaki maʻa ia foki.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * vavae tonga, ['kapok']; koʻeni * vavae, ''Gossypium hirsutum'' (MALVACEAE), ['Polynesian cotton'] * vavae pālangi, ''Gossypium barbadense'', ['Egyptian cotton'] * [[tuʻulapepe|vavaekona]]
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == (kapau ʻoku ʻoatu ʻa e hingoa ʻe taha pē, ko e vavai tonga mo e vavae pālangi ia. * vavae (vavae tonga: [[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) ** vavae Sāmoa (vavae pālangi) * vavae ([[lea fakaniuē]]) * vavai popaʻā (vavae tonga: [[lea fakatahisi]]) ** vavai (vavae pālangi) * kīʻailana, pulupulu, pulupulu haole (vavae pālangi: [[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) * mamaʻu, tumu mamaʻu, vavai (vavae tonga: [[lea fakakuki]]) ** vavaī, vavaī papaʻā, komiro ina (vavae pālangi) * puatio, uruuru, uruuruvaikirita (vavae tonga: [[lea fakamākuise]]) ** uru (vavae pālangi) * vauvau ni vavalangi ([[lea fakafisi]])
== Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Multipurpose trees for agroforestry in the Pacific islands; R.R. Thaman, C.R. Elevitch, K.M. Wilkinson * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Lekileki
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Puzzlenut |faitā=Xylocarpus granatum.jpg |faitālaulahi= 320px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[sapindales]] |familia= [[MELIACEAE]] |genus=Xylocarpus |species=granatum |fakamoʻoniʻanga= König }} Ko e '''lekileki''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia. Hono ngaahi tenga ʻi he foʻi fua ʻoku ngalingali ha meʻa ke fifiliʻi.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *lekileki; koʻeni *lekileki; ''Xylocarpus moluccensis'' *lekileki milo
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *legilegi ([[lea fakalau]]) *dabi ([[lea fakafisi]]) *leʻileʻi ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]])
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler; ISBN 978-0-8248-1528-8 *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Hoi
Hoi (ʻakau)
Toi
Pakaka
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Cinderella weed, Node weed, Pig grass |faitā=Synedrella nodiflora.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[asterales]] |familia= [[ASTERACEAE]] pe COMPOSITAE |tribus=heliantheae |genus=Synedrella |species=nodiflora |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]]) Gaertn. |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''pakaka''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi, ko e vao ia, ʻoku tupu ʻi he feituʻu kotoa pē. ʻOku ngāueʻaki ʻa e toʻi ʻi hono lou maʻa e faitoʻo ʻo e lavea. ʻOku siʻisiʻi pē ʻa hono matalaʻiʻakau, neongo ko e lauʻimatala ʻi tuʻa ʻoku fakalahi.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *pakaka; koʻeni; kā ʻoku ʻoatu ʻa e hingoa ʻe Yuncker ki he ''Erigeron sumatrensis'' pe ''Conyza sumatrensis'' (Retz.) E. Walker pe ''Conyza albidus'' Willd. ex Sprengl. pe ''Conyza floribunda'', ko e faʻahinga kehe ʻaupito ia, ʻoku meimei tatau ʻene ʻasi mo ha [[pakopako]], ko e faʻahinga mei he kāinga ʻo e [[pako]] *pakopako; ko e hingoa ʻoku ngāueʻaki ʻe Yuncker maʻa ʻeni; mahalo naʻe fetongi ? *pakaka, ''Eleutheranthera ruderalis'' (Sw.) Sch. Bip., (ASTERACEAE); ʻoku meimei tatau mo e ''Synedrella nodiflora'', kae ko hono matalaʻiʻakau ʻoku siʻisiʻi ange koeʻuhi ʻoku ʻikai fakalahi ʻa e ngaahi lauʻimatala, ko e lahi ʻe taha pē ʻo nautolu, pea ko e tuʻunga ʻo e ngaahi lou ʻoku taʻefuopotopoto ange.
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *tauatini (=tahaafe) ([[lea fakatahisi]]) *lauʻotiʻoti, taeʻoti (=taʻeʻosi) ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *ngaroiarui ([[lea fakakuki]])
==Tataku== *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/synedrella_nodiflora.htm *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6694 *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/eleutheranthera_ruderalis.htm *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6100 *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Lile veʻemoa
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Glory lily, Flame lily |faitā= Gloriosa superba 1.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻitaha]] |ordo= [[liliales]] |familia= [[GOLCHICACEAE]] |genus=Gloriosa |species=superba |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= c }} Ko e ''Lile veʻemoa'' (hingoa taʻefakalakanga) ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi mo e totolo ia. ʻOku ʻiloa ʻi he kāungafonua ʻo e [[Pasifiki]], kā ʻoku teʻeki tupu ʻi Tongá ni ngata pē ʻi he ngoue kakala. ʻOmi mei [[ʻAfelika]].
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == *[[lile]] *[[lile lalahi]] *[[lile pilisipeni]] *[[lile kula]] *[[lile lēpati]] *[[lile kalukalu]]
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == *riri vavai-moa, riri vaevae mokorā, tiare mokora ([[lea fakakuki]])
== Tataku == *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/gloriosa_superba.htm *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6181 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Tavahi
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Island sumac |faitā=Rhus taitensis.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[sapindales]] |familia= [[ANACARDIACEAE]] |genus=Rhus |species=taitensis |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Jean Baptiste Antoine Guillemin|Guill.]] |fehokotaki= s }} [[File:Rhus taitensis, flowering.jpg|left|320px|thumb|matala]] Ko e '''tavahi''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ʻaupito ia, mo e ʻakau sai maʻa e kau tufunga. ʻOku ui foki ko e ''R. rufa'' pe ''R. retusa''.
ʻOku ne matala ʻi Tongá ni ʻi Tisema.
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * neleau ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]], ''Rhus sandwicensis'') * tavai ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]], [[lea fakaʻuvea]], [[lea fakafutuna]])
== Tataku == * http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=13428 * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 * D.R. Drake et al., Rain forest vegetation of ʻEua Island, New Zealand Journal of Botany '''34''', 1996 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Toto
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Suicide tree |faitā=Cerbera odollam.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[gentianales]] |familia= [[APOCYNACEAE]] |genus=Cerbera |species=odollam |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} [[Image:Cerbera manghas InflorescencesFlower BotGardBln0906a.jpg|left|240px|thumb|leva (C. manghas)]] Ko e '''toto''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia. Ko e ngaahi ''Cerbera'' kotoa (mei he kulī ʻulutolu [[fakakālisi]] ko [[Kerberos]]) ʻoku fakamate ʻaupito hono fua mo e toʻi. ʻOku tupu ofi ki he tahi, tatau mo e [[tongo]], kā ʻi he ngaahi fonua ʻe niʻihi ʻoku tupu ʻi moʻunga foki.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *toto, leva, ''Cerbera manghas''; (Sea mango) ʻoku tupu pē ʻi he [[:Category:ongo Niua|ongo Niua]], ʻoku ui ko e '''leva''' ʻi hē. *toto; koʻeni, ʻoku tupu ʻi he ngaahi feituʻu kotoa pē ʻo Tongá ni. ʻOku meimei tatau mo e leva, pea ʻoku faʻa aleituʻu ʻa e kakai ʻi ai. *toto hina, ''Bleekeria vitiensis'' (APOCYNACEAE) *toto kula *toto fisi
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *leva ([[lea fakaʻuvea]], [[lea fakahaʻamoa]], [[lea fakafutuna]], ''C.manghas'') *reva ([[lea fakatahisi]], ''C. Odollam'') *vasa ([[lea fakafisi]])
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler; ISBN 978-0-8248-1528-8 *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 *D.R. Drake et al., Rain forest vegetation of ʻEua Island, New Zealand Journal of Botany '''34''', 1996 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Tava
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Pacific lychee |faitā=Pometia pinnata.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[sapindales]] |familia= [[SAPINDACEAE]] |genus=Pometia |species=pinnata |fakamoʻoniʻanga= J.R. Forster & J.G. Forster }} [[Image:Pometia pinnata, flowering.jpg|left|320px|thumb|ʻI heʻene matala]] Ko e '''tava''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia mo e ngaahi foʻi fua ifo. ʻOku ui foki ko e ''P. acuminata'', ''P. alnifolia'', ''P. glabra'', ''P. tomentosa'', ''Nephelium pinnata'', ''Euphoria pinnata'' mo e ''E. pometia''. Vakai ki he ngaahi lou mui, ʻoku nau kulokula ʻaupito.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *tava; koʻeni *tava pālangi, ''Litchi chinensis'' (SAPINDACEAE) [(ordinary) lychee] *tava fulufulua, ''Nephelium lappaceum'' (SAPINDACEAE) [rambutan] *tava kula — tenga kulokula *tava moli *tava touʻa *tava tahisi — kili kulokula mo fefeka *tava hina — tea
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *tava ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]], [[lea fakaʻuvea]], [[lea fakafutuna]], [[lea fakakuki]]) *dawa ([[lea fakafisi]])
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Multipurpose trees for agroforestry in the Pacific islands; R.R. Thaman, C.R. Elevitch, K.M. Wilkinson *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Siolaʻā
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Silverleaf sunflower |faitā=Sunflower Blüte.JPG |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[asterales]] |familia= [[ASTERACEAE]] |genus=Helianthus |species=argophyllus |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[John Torrey|Torr.]] & [[Asa Gray|A. Gray]] |fehokotaki= s }} Ko e '''siolaʻā''' (Helianthus) ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia, ʻomi mei [[ʻAmelika]]. ʻOku ʻi ai ʻi māmani ngaahi faʻahinga ʻe 67, kā ko e faʻahinga ʻoku faʻafai ʻi Tongá ni ko e ''H. argophyllus'' ia, pe ''H. annuus''. ʻOku lahi ʻaupito hono matala, mahalo pē senitimita ʻe 20 tupu.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * [[siolaʻā siʻi]] * [[siolaʻā mekesikō]]
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * siolaʻa ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) (ko e hala ia?) * tiare āru-rā ([[lea fakakuki]])
== Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * http://www.hear.org/pier/species/helianthus_argophyllus.htm * http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6206 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Vaʻepaka
Fueʻaepuaka
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Kudzu, Japanese arrowroot |faitā=Pueraria lobata ja02.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[fabales]] |familia= [[FABACEAE]] |genus=Pueraria |species=montana var. lobata |fakamoʻoniʻanga= (Willd.) Sanjappa & Pradeep |fehokotaki= c }} Ko e '''fue ʻa e puaka''' pe '''fue fakahinga''' pe '''aka''' pe '''aka taha''', ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi mo e totolo ia. ʻOku kehe ʻa hono kāinga mo e ngaahi fua kehe. Ko e vao ia, ʻoku vave ʻene tupu. ʻOku ui pehē koeʻuhi ʻoku manakoa ʻaupito ʻe he fanga puaka. ʻOku ui foki ko e ''Pueraria montana'' var. ''lobata'', ''Pueraria thunbergiana'', ''Pueraria triloba'' pea mo e ''Dolichos lobatus''.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == Vakai ki he [[fue]] maʻa e lahi ngaahi fue kehe.
Vakai ki he [[akataha]] maʻa e lahi ngaahi akataha kehe.
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * aka, aka fala, fou gau ([[lea fakaniuē]]) * aʻa ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * qariaka, wa yaka ([[lea fakafisi]]) * kūtū (=kudzu) ([[lea fakakuki]], ''P. phaseoloides'')
== Tataku == * http://www.hear.org/pier/species/pueraria_montana_var_lobata.htm * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Fuekulaʻahoʻaho
Laveʻimoa leka
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Wild poinsettia, Dwarf poinsettia, Mexican fireplant |faitā=Euphorbia cyathophora.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malpighiales]] |familia= [[EUPHORBIACEAE]] |genus=Euphorbia |species=cyathophora |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Johan Andreas Murray|Murr.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''laveʻimoa leka''' (hingoa taʻefakalakanga) ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia mo e ngaahi ʻila kuloklula ʻi hono lou. Ko e ʻakau muli, ʻomi mei [[ʻAmelika]]-loto. ʻOku tatau mo e ''Poinsettia cyathophora'' pe ''Euphorbia heterophylla'', neongo ʻe pehē ʻe he kau saienisi ʻe taha, ʻoku kehe ko e ''E. heterophylla'', ʻoku kulamaama pē ʻene ngaahi ʻila.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *[[laveʻimoa]] *laveʻimoa leka; koʻeni
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *toto uli ([[lea fakaniuē]]) *tiare tūpāpaku ''(=siale faʻahikehe)'' ([[lea fakakuki]] tokelau)
==Tataku== *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6136 *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/euphorbia_cyathophora.htm *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Kihikihitahi
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Beach spurge |faitā=Euphorbia atoto.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malpighiales]] |familia= [[EUPHORBIACEAE]] |genus=Euphorbia |species=atoto |fakamoʻoniʻanga= G. Forst. }} Ko e '''kihikihitahi''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia. ʻOku lahi ʻene tupu ʻi he tuʻaliku. ʻOku ui foki ''Chamaesyce atoto'', ''E. chamissonis'', ''C. chamissonis'', ''Euphorbia ramosissimum'', ''E. tahitensis'', ''C. fosbergii'' ʻi he [[lea fakalatina]] ʻe he kau saienisi ʻe niʻihi. ʻOku ui foki '''kavahuhu(tahi)''' pe '''ngingieʻuta''' ʻe he kakai Tonga, (vakai ki lalo).
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *kavahuhu; koʻeni **kavahuhutahi; koʻeni **kavahuhulalahi; koʻeni *kavahuhu, ''Tephrosia purpurea'' (FABACEAE) **kavahuhuʻuta **kavahuhuveli *kihikihi; ʻoku lahi ngaahi ʻakau ʻoku ui ko e kihikihi **[[kihikihi]] **[[kihikihi (ngeʻesitenga pipiki)]] **kihikihitahi; koʻeni **kihikihilanumata, ''Galactia tenuiflora'' **[[kihikihimaka]] **[[tamole|kihikihingingie]] **[[kihikihipālangi]] *ngingieʻuta; koʻeni *ngingieʻuta, tatau mo e [[ngingie]]
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *toto ([[lea fakaniuē]]) *ʻatoto ([[lea fakatahisi]]) *pulu tai ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) **laʻau fai moti (''Chamaesyce hirta'') *totototo, kōtotototo ([[lea fakakuki]]) *totolu, totoyava ([[lea fakafisi]])
==Tataku== *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=5914 *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler; ISBN 978-0-8248-1528-8 *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Kolotoni
Ikuʻipusi
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= |faitā=Uraria lagopodioides.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[fabales]] |familia= [[FABACEAE]] |genus=Uraria |species=lagopodioides |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]]) Desv. ex DC. }} [[Image:Acalypha Hispida DS.jpg|left|320px|thumb|Ikuʻipusi kulaʻahoʻaho]] Ko e '''ikuʻipusi''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia mo e ngaahi kiʻi matalaʻiʻakau lanufekika, ʻoku tatau ʻene ʻasi mo e hiku ʻo e pusi. Ko e ʻakau vao ia. ʻOku tatau mo e ''Uraria lagopodoides'' mo e ''Uraria lagopoides'' DC. mo e ''Hedysarum lagopodioides'' mo e hā fua.
Kā ʻoku ʻi ai ʻa e faʻahinga kehe, ko e '''ikuʻipusi kulaʻahoʻaho''' (hingoa taʻefakalakanga) [red-hot cat's-tail, chenille plant]. ʻOku lōloa ange mo e ʻahoʻaho ange mo e fakaʻofoʻofa ange hono "hiku". ʻOku manakoa ʻi he ngoue kakala. ʻOku ui ko e [[kalakalaʻāpusi]] ʻe he tokotaha, neongo ko e faʻahinga kehe mei he kāinga tatau pē ia.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *ikuʻipusi; koʻeni *ikuʻipusi kulaʻahoʻaho, ''Acalypha hispida'' [[Nicolaas Laurens Burman|Burm.f.]] (FABACEAE)
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== ===ikuʻipusi=== *uluhenga ([[lea fakaniuē]]) *lala ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *lakanikasa, lakanirase, setamoli ([[lea fakafisi]]) ===ikuʻipusi kulaʻahoʻaho<ref>''kiore'': kumā pe monumanu, ''ngiāo'': ngau (ʻo e pusi), ''mīmī'': pusi (miaumiau), ''ʻ(a)ero'': hiku</ref>=== *ʻaero mīmī ([[lea fakatahisi]]) *siʻusiʻu pusi ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *ʻiku kiorengiāo, ʻaere mīmī, ʻuku kiore, ʻērō mīmī ([[lea fakakuki]]) <references/>
==Tataku== *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=5690 *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Fakafaʻafaʻahinga fakasaienisi
page.category: Saienisi ʻo e moʻui
page.text:
[[File:Biological classification S Pengo.svg|right|frame]] Ko e saienisi ʻo e '''fakafaʻafaʻahinga''', ʻa ia ko e '''fakafaʻafaʻahinga ʻi he saienisi ʻo e meʻamoʻui''', ko e ako ia ʻo e vahevahe pe fokotuʻutuʻu ʻo e ngaahi meʻamoʻui. ʻOku ui foki ko e '''tasonomia''' (taxonomy). Naʻe kamata mo e [[Carolus Linnaeus]] (1707–1778) ʻi he teautaʻu hono 18. ʻOku lahi ʻa e ngaahi angafai ngāueʻaki ʻe he kau saienisi ʻe niʻihi, kā ʻoku faʻa sīpingaʻaki koʻeni:
[[lea fakatonga]][[lea fakalatina]][[lea fakapilitānia]]tokangaʻi
ʻemipaeasuperregnumdomain
'''puleʻanga'''regnumkingdom
'''vahe'''divisio ''pe'' phylumdivision ''or'' phylum''divisio'' maʻa e ngaahi ʻakau, ''phylum'' maʻa e fanga monumanu.
'''haʻa'''classisclass
'''holongā'''ordoorder
'''kāinga'''familiafamily
matakalitribustribe
'''kāinga ofi'''genusgenus
kupusectiosection
fokotuʻungaseriesseries
'''faʻahinga'''speciesspecies
fakakeheʻivarietasvarietyʻoku tohi: var.
fuoformaform
Ko e ngaahi hingoa '''mataʻitohi matatoʻa''' ʻoku ngāueʻaki taimi kotoa pē, ko e toenga ʻoku sai ke toʻo. Ko hoʻo faʻiteliha pē ke ngāueʻaki ko e ''ʻemipaea'': * kapau te ke ngāueʻaki ai, ʻoku ʻi ai ʻe ua: ko e meʻamoʻui fakalokiʻimoʻui mo e meʻamoʻui taʻefakalokiʻimoʻui. ʻI he ʻuluaki (meʻamoʻui fakalokiʻimoʻui) ʻoku ʻi ai ʻa e ngaahi ''puleʻanga'' ʻe fā: [[ʻakau]] (plantae), [[monumanu]] (animalia), [[talingelinga]] (fungi), mo e [[meʻamoʻuimuʻa]] (protista). ʻI he fakaʻosi (meʻamoʻui taʻefakalokiʻimoʻui) ʻoku ʻi ai ha ngaahi siemu, vailasi, mo e hā fua. * kapau ʻe ʻikai te ke ngāueʻaki ai, ʻoku ʻi ai ha ngaahi ''puleʻanga'' ʻe ono pe lahi ange: ʻakau, monumanu, talingelinga, meʻamoʻuimuʻa, siemu, vailasi. ʻOku lava ke te tānaki ʻa e ngaahi tuʻunga fakalahi ʻo fai ha fakafaʻafaʻahinga mata iiki ange. Ko e ''super'' ʻi muʻa, mo e ''sub'' pea mo e ''infra'' ʻi mui. Fakatātā ʻi he haʻa:
haʻa lahisuperclassis
haʻaclassis
haʻa siʻisubclassis
haʻa siʻi angeinfraclassis
Ko e ''kāinga ofi'' mo e ''faʻahinga'' ʻoku tupu ki he [[hingoa kakato lōua]] ʻo e meʻamoʻui. ʻOku tohi ia ''mataʻitohi mahei'' mo e mataʻitohi lahi ʻi he mataʻitohi ʻuluaki pē. Fakatātā: ''Homo sapiens''. == Tohi hokohoko == Vakai ki he [[:Category:Tohi hokohoko ʻo e fanga meʻamoʻui ko honau hingoa fakalatina]] [[Category:Saienisi ʻo e moʻui]] [[de:Taxonomie#Taxonomie in der Biologie]] [[nl:Taxonomie#Taxonomie in de biologie]]

page.title: Lata
Kaute mohe
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Sleeping hibiscus, Turk's cap |faitā=Malvaviscus-penduliflorus.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malvales]] |familia= [[MALVACEAE]] |genus= Malvaviscus |species= penduliflorus |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Antonio José Cavanilles|Cav.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''kaute mohe''' (hingoa taʻefakalakanga) ko e ʻakau mo e ngaahi matalaʻiʻakau lahi mo e kulokula. Kā ʻoku toe mapuni ʻa e ngaahi matalaʻiʻakau, pea ʻoku nau tāupe ki lalo. ʻOku manakoa ʻa e ʻakau ʻi he ngoue kakala pe ngāueʻaki he ʻā koeʻuhi ʻoku tangitangi meimei taimi kotoa pē.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *kaute mohe, ʻoku ui foki ko e ''Malvaviscus arboreus'' var. ''penduliflorus''; koʻeni *kaute mohe, ''M. arboreus''; ko e matalaʻiʻakau tuʻu ki ʻolunga. *[[fau]] *[[kaute]]
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *kaute, kaute moe, kaute makatea, kaute ʻōporo ([[lea fakakuki]])
==Tataku== *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6366 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Kalakalaʻāpusi
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Copperleaf, Jacob's Coat |faitā=Acalypha wilkesiana.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malpighiales]] |familia= [[EUPHORBIACEAE]] |genus=Acalypha |species=wilkesiana |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Johannes Müller Argoviensis|Müll.Arg.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} [[Image:Acalypha wilkesiana forma circinata.jpg|left|320px|thumb|kalakalaʻāpusi; lau fāʻū]] Ko e '''kalakalaʻāpusi''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia mei he kāinga ''Acalypha'' (lau kopa). Ko e ʻakau ʻomi mei [[Fisi]], kā ʻoku ʻikai tuʻufonua ʻi hē. Mahalo pē naʻa ne fakatupu mei [[Maleisia]].
ʻOku ʻikai pau ʻa e tupuʻanga ʻo hono hingoa. Ko e kalakala ʻa e pusi ia, pe ko e foʻi lea kehe ʻomi mei Fisi: ''kalabuci''?
Ko e ʻuhinga tatau: ''Acalypha tricolor'' (koeʻuhi ko e tapa engeenga).
ʻOku kehe foki mo e [[ikuʻipusi|ikuʻipusi kulaʻahoʻaho]], neongo ko e kāinga tatau pē.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *kalakalaʻāpusi, ''A. wilkesiana'' forma ''circinata''; lau lanumata mo e fāʻū *kalakalaʻāpusi; lau lanukopa
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *kāpaiē, kaope pā (''=pā kopa'') ([[lea fakakuki]]) *kalabuci, damu ([[lea fakafisi]], ''Acalypha virgata'') *kalaapuhi ([[lea fakaʻuvea]], ''Acalypha grandis'') *kalaapusi ([[lea fakafutuna]], ''Acalypha grandis'')
==Tataku== *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=5694 *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Hongohongo
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Hen's nettle |faitā= |faitālaulahi= 320px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[rosales]] |familia= [[URTICACEAE]] |genus=Laportea |species=interrupta |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]]) Chew }} {{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Acalypha weed |faitā= |faitālaulahi= 320px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malpighiales]] |familia= [[EUPHORBIACEAE]] |genus=Acalypha |species=lanceolata |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carl Ludwig Willdenow|Willd.]] |fehokotaki= s }} Ko e '''hongohongo''' (pe '''nongonongo''' ?) ʻe taha ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia mei he kāinga ''Urticaceae'', tatau mo e [[salato]]. ʻOku ui foki ko e ''Fleurya interrupta'' (L.) Chew.
Ko e '''hongohongo''' ʻe taha ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia mei he kāinga ''Acalypha'' (lau kopa). ʻOku ui foki ko e ''Acalypha boehmerioides'' Miq. ʻOku tupu pē ʻi [[:Category:Vavaʻu|Vavaʻu]] mo e [[:Category:Ongo Niua|Ongo Niua]].
ʻOku ʻikai pau, ʻoku ʻi ai ʻa e ngaahi ʻakau ʻe ua mo hona hingoa tatau, pe naʻe puputuʻu ʻa e kakai pea naʻa nau fetongi kinaua? Kakai Tonga, mo e kakai ʻi he kaungāfonua foki, pea mo e kau saienisi ?
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== ===Fleurya=== *ogoogo ([[lea fakaniuē]]) *mageo ([[lea fakaʻuvea]]) *huriaeo, iriaio, urieo ([[lea fakatahisi]]) *ogoogo, vao mageso ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *auokaoka, kenae, onaona, onaona, puera ([[lea fakamākuise]]) *salato, salato ni koro, salato vutivali ([[lea fakafisi]]) ===Acalypha=== *magiho, ogoogo ([[lea fakaniuē]]) **hogohogo, ogoogo (''Acalypha indica'' L., ʻoku ʻikai tupu ʻi Tongá ni) *ogoogo ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *māngiongio, puapua ([[lea fakakuki]])
==Tataku== *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/fleurya_interrupta.htm *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/acalypha_lanceolata.htm *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=5691 *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Maileminiti
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Cairo morning-glory, Messina creeper |faitā=Ipomoea cairica.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[solanales]] |familia= [[CONVOLVULACEAE]] |genus=Ipomoea |species=cairica |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]]) [[Robert Sweet|Sweet]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''maile miniti''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi mo e totolo ia, ko e faʻahinga [[fue]]. ʻOku pehē ʻoku fuʻu vave ʻene tupu, ʻe lava ʻe tupu ia ki he maile ʻe taha ʻi he miniti ʻe taha. ʻOku kehe ʻaupito mei he [[maile]]. Ko e ʻuhinga tatau ko e ''I. tuberculata''.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *maileminiti; koʻeni *maileminiti, fuesiaina, ''Mikania micrantha'' (CONVOLVULACEAE); ko e ''mile a minute weed'' moʻoni, ʻi muli
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *sefifi sea ([[lea fakaniuē]]) *kowali, koali, koali ʻaiʻai, koali lau manamana, paʻaliʻi, ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) *sosomia ([[lea fakaʻuvea]]) *wasovivi ([[lea fakafisi]])
==Tataku== *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/ipomoea_cairica.htm *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Kuava
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Common guava |faitā=Goiaba.JPG |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[myrtales]] |familia= [[MYRTACEAE]] |genus=Psidium |species=guajava |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''kuava''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia mo e ngaahi foʻi fua ʻoku manakoa lahi ʻe he kakai Tonga. Kā ko e ngaahi fuʻu kuava ʻi [[ʻEua]] ʻoku fuʻu lahi, ʻoku vaoa kovi ʻaupito.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * kuava, kuava 'apple'; koʻeni * kuava hina * kuava kula * kuava papālangi * kuava 'strawberry', ''P. cattleianum'' (=kuava kula ?); foʻi fua kulokula * kuava 'yellowberry', ''P. llitorale'' * kuava 'pineapple', ''Feigoa sellowiana'' (MYRTACEAE)
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * kautoga, kautoga tāne ([[lea fakaniuē]]) * tūava, tuvava ([[lea fakatahisi]]) ** tūava pōpaʻa, tūava tinito (''P. cattleianum'') * kuʻava ([[lea fakatūvalu]]) * kuawa, kuawa keʻokeʻo, kuawa lemi, kuawa momona, pauwa [[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) ** waiawī ʻulaʻula (''P. cattleianum'') * kuava ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * tūava, tūvava, tuava ʻenua ([[lea fakakuki]]) ** tūava papaʻā (''P. cattleianum'') * quava, quava ni Idia, quwawa ([[lea fakafisi]])
== Tataku == * http://www.hear.org/pier/species/psidium_guajava.htm * http://www.issg.org/features/invasives_on_tonga.html * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Multipurpose trees for agroforestry in the Pacific islands; R.R. Thaman, C.R. Elevitch, K.M. Wilkinson * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 * D.R. Drake et al., Rain forest vegetation of ʻEua Island, New Zealand Journal of Botany '''34''', 1996 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Volovalo
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= |faitā=Premna serratifolia.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[lamiales]] |familia= [[VERBENACEAE]] |genus=Premna |species=serratifolia |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= s }} Ko e '''volovalo''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia. Ko e faitoʻo mahuʻinga mo e tukufakaholo hono lau. Ko hono ngaahi ʻuhinga tatau: ''Premna integriflora'', ''P. taitensis'', ''P. taitensis'' var ''Rimatarensis'', ''P. gaudichaudii''.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *volovalo; koʻeni *volovalo,''Premna obtusifolia''; kapau ko e faʻahinga ʻikai tatau mo e ''P. serratifolia'', ko e fuʻu ʻakau ʻoku siʻisiʻi ange
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *aloalo ([[lea fakaniuē]], [[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *ʻāvaro ([[lea fakatahisi]], [[lea fakakuki]]) *yaro ([[lea fakafisi]])
==Tataku== *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6573 *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Multipurpose trees for agroforestry in the Pacific islands; R.R. Thaman, C.R. Elevitch, K.M. Wilkinson *Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler; ISBN 978-0-8248-1528-8 *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 *D.R. Drake et al., Rain forest vegetation of ʻEua Island, New Zealand Journal of Botany '''34''', 1996 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Kiukamipā
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Cucumber |faitā=Komkommer_plant.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[cucurbitales]] |familia= [[CUCURBITACEAE]] |genus=Cucumis |species=sativus |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''kiukamipā''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia. ʻOku sai ʻo kai hono foʻi fua.
== Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Fuevao
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Bush morning-glory |faitā=Ipomoea carnea.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[solanales]] |familia= [[CONVOLVULACEAE]] |genus=Ipomoea |species=carnea |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Nicolaus Joseph von Jacquin|N.Jacq.]] |fehokotaki= s }} Ko e '''fuevao''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi mo e totolo ia. ʻOku ʻi ai lahi ngaahi fue kehekehe, kā ko e ʻakaú ni, ʻoku ʻi ai ʻa hano lau lausiʻi. ʻOku ui foki ko e ''Ipomoea crassicaulis'' pe ''I. fistulosa''. Ko e ʻakau toki ʻomi ki Tonga. ʻOku ne tupu pē ʻi he ʻapi ngoue.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== Vakai ki he [[fue]], ʻoku toe lahi ngaahi fue.
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *tiare kūmara ([[lea fakakuki]])
==Tataku== *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6269 *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Tongolei
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Red mangrove |faitā=Rhizophora mangle BotGardBln1105RootsLeaves.JPG |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malpighiales]] |familia= [[RHIZOPHORACEAE]] |genus=Rhizophora |species=mangle |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= cs}} [[File:Rhizophora mangle.jpg|left|240px|thumb|lauʻitongo, matalaʻitongo, tengaʻitongo]] Ko e '''tongolei''' (pe '''tongo''') ko e fuʻu ʻakau ia, tupu ʻi he tahi. [[File:Rhizophora mangle MHNT.BOT.2010.12.12.jpg|thumb|''Rhizophora mangle'']]
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * tongo, tongolei; koʻeni, ʻuhinga tatau: ''Rhizophora samoensis'' * [[tongo]], ''Bruguiera sp.'' * tongo taʻane, ''Rhizophora mucronata'', ''Rhizophora stylosa'', [Giant mangrove]; ʻoku meimei tatau mo e tongolei, kā ʻoku ʻi ai ʻa e lau muʻamāsila ʻa e ''R. mucronata'' Kā ʻoku ʻi ai ha kakai ʻoku pehē ʻoku tatau ʻa e tongo taʻane mo e tongo (Bruguiera). ʻOku ʻi ai ha kakai ʻoku pehē ʻoku tatau ʻa e tongolei mo e ''Bruguiera'', pea ʻoku tatau ʻa e tongo mo e ''Rhizophora''.
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * togo ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * dogo ([[lea fakafisi]])
== Tataku == * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler * Multipurpose trees for agroforestry in the Pacific islands; R.R. Thaman, C.R. Elevitch, K.M. Wilkinson * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Monomonoʻahina
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Pacific flag tree |faitā=Mussaenda raiateensis.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[gentianales]] |familia= [[RUBIACEAE]] |genus=Mussaenda |species=raiateensis |fakamoʻoniʻanga= J.W.Moore }} Ko e '''monomono ʻa hina''' pe '''monomono''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia. ʻI he taimi tangitangi ʻoku lahi hano lauʻimatala lahi mo e hinehina, neongo ʻoku siʻisiʻi pē ʻa e ngaahi matala engeenga. ʻOku ʻasi ʻa e fuʻu ʻakau mo e lau hinehina ʻi ʻolunga. ʻOku meimei tatau mo e ''M. frondosa'' L., ka ʻoku lanumoli ange ʻa e ngaahi matalaʻiʻakau ''frondosa''.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *monomonoʻahina *[[monomonoʻakula]]
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *aloalo vao ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *kōtuku ([[lea fakakuki]])
==Tataku== *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6420 *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 *D.R. Drake et al., Rain forest vegetation of ʻEua Island, New Zealand Journal of Botany '''34''', 1996 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Monomonoʻakula
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Pink flag tree |faitā=Mussaenda 'queen sirikit'.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[gentianales]] |familia= [[RUBIACEAE]] |genus=Mussaenda |species=erythrophylla × philippica |fakamoʻoniʻanga= Schumach. & Thonn. }} Ko e '''monomono ʻa kula''' (hingoa taʻefakalakanga) ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia. ʻI he taimi tangitangi ʻoku lahi hano lauʻimatala lahi mo e kulamaama, neongo ʻoku siʻisiʻi pē ʻa e ngaahi matala engeenga (''philippica'') pe hinehina (''erythrophylla''). ʻOku ʻasi ʻa e fuʻu ʻakau mo e lau kulamaama ʻi ʻolunga.
Ko e ʻakau foʻou mo e ngoueʻia ia, kā ʻoku toe manakoa ʻi Tongá ni. Ko e ''erythrophylla × philippica'', ʻopku ui foki ko e ''Mussaenda queen [[Sirikit]]''.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *[[monomonoʻahina]] *monomonoʻakula
==Tataku== *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=14113 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Polo
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Chilli-, Bird-, Tabasco-pepper |faitā=Tabasco_peppers.JPG |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[solanales]] |familia= [[SOLANACEAE]] |genus=Capsicum |species=frutescens |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''polo fifisi''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia mo e ngaahi foʻi fua fifisi siʻisiʻi pē aʻu ki he fifisi ʻaupito. Ko e ʻakau ʻeni mo e ngaahi ''capsica'' kotoa pē, ʻoku fifisi pehē. Ko e tupuʻanga ʻo e fifisi ko e [[capsaicin]] ia, ko e meʻa [[kemi]], 8-methyl-N-vanillyl-6-nonenamide.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *polo; ko e polo kotoa pē, pe ko e polofifisi totonu *polofifisi; koʻeni, kā ʻoku tui he onopooni ʻoku ne fakakeheʻi pē ʻo e ''C. annuum'' *polopālangi, ''C. annuum'', [bell pepper, green pepper]; ʻoku ʻikai fifisi *polokai, ''Solanum americanum'' (SOLANACEAE), [American nightshade]; ko hono ngaahi foʻi fua ʻoku lanufisiʻifekika ʻuliʻuli, ʻoku lava ke kai *polokai, ''Solanum nigrum'' [black nightshade]; fuʻu meimei tatau mo e ''S. americanum'', ko hono ngaahi foʻi fua ʻoku lanumata ʻuliʻuli, kā ʻoku fakakona ke kai *polotonga, ''Solanum uporo'' pe ''S. oleraceum'' *polotonga, ''Solanum viride'', [[green nightshade]] *[[polohauaiʻi]], ''Solanum capsicoides'' *polopā, ''Physalis minima'' mo e ''Physalis angulata'' (SOLANACEAE) *polo, ''Rivinia humilis''; ko e ʻasi ʻo hono foʻi fua meimei tatau mo e polo moʻoni *[[pula]]; mo e pula ʻe taha, vakai foki ki he [[fuehina]] *puko, ''Solanum vitiense''; tātātaha; ʻoku kehe mei he [[puko]]
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *poro magiho, poro miti ([[lea fakaniuē]]) *nīoi, nīoi pepa ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) *polo, polo papalagi, polo vao, polo uli ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *ʻōporo ([[lea fakatahisi]], [[lea fakakuki]]) *poroporo ([[lea fakamauli]] ''Solanum aviculare'') *boro, boro ni vavalagi, boro gaga ([[lea fakafisi]])
==Tataku== *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/capsicum_frutescens.htm *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=5874 *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Fetonginauna maʻunimā
page.category: Lea fakatonga
page.text:
Fetonginauna
maʻunimā		 pau pe
ʻikai		 faʻahinga singulalitualipalulali
supiesi ʻopiesi supiesi ʻopiesi supiesi ʻopiesi
faʻahi ʻaʻaku
(1 -koe)		 pau faʻafai ''he''ʻeku hoku ''he''ʻema homa ''heʻ''emau homau
taʻepau haʻaku haku haʻama hama haʻamau hamau
pau lotoueʻi siʻeku siʻoku siʻema siʻoma siʻemau siʻomau
taʻepau siʻaku siʻaku siʻama siʻama siʻamau siʻamau
fakamatemate haʻaku hoʻoku haʻamaua hoʻomaua haʻamautolu hoʻomautolu
faʻahi ʻaʻata
(1 +koe)		 pau faʻafai ''he''ʻete hoto ''he''ʻeta hota ''he''ʻetau hotau
taʻepau haʻate hato haʻata hata haʻatau hatau
pau lotoueʻi siʻete siʻoto siʻeta siʻota siʻetau siʻotau
taʻepau siʻate siʻato siʻata siʻata siʻatau siʻatau
fakamatemate haʻata hoʻota haʻataua hoʻotaua haʻatautolu hoʻotautolu
faʻahi ʻaʻau
(2)		 pau faʻafai hoʻo ho hoʻomo homo hoʻomou homou
taʻepau haʻo hao haʻamo hamo haʻamou hamou
pau lotoueʻi siʻo siʻo siʻomo siʻomo siʻomou siʻomou
taʻepau siʻao siʻao siʻamo siʻamo siʻamou siʻamou
fakamatemate haʻau hoʻou haʻamoua hoʻomoua haʻamoutolu hoʻomoutolu
faʻahi ʻaʻana
(3)		 pau faʻafai ''he''ʻene hono ''he''ʻena hona ''he''ʻenau honau
taʻepau haʻane hano haʻana hana haʻanau hanau
pau lotoueʻi siʻene siʻono siʻena siʻona siʻenau siʻonau
taʻepau siʻane siʻano siʻana siʻana siʻanau siʻanau
fakamatemate haʻana hoʻona haʻanaua hoʻonaua haʻanautolu hoʻonautolu
Manatuʻi: *ko e ngaahi fetonginauna maʻunimā faʻafai ʻoku ʻi ai ʻenau [[fakauʻa]] maʻa e fetonginauna supiesi pea ʻoku ʻikai ʻi ai maʻa e fetonginauna ʻopiesi. *ko e ngaahi fetonginauna maʻunimā faʻafai pau, ʻoku nau kamata mo e ''he'', ʻoku nau toʻo ia kapau ʻikai ʻi mui ʻo e ''ʻe'', ''ʻi'', ''ki'' mo e ''mei''. Fakatātā: ʻi heʻeku tohi, ko ʻeku tohi. *ko e ngaahi fetonginauna maʻunimā fakamatemate, kapau ʻoku ngāueʻaki ʻe maʻu ʻa e [[fakamamafa]] taimi kotoa pē. ʻOku tātātaha ʻenau ngāueʻaki. [[Category:Lea fakatonga]]

page.title: Tisaipale
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Prickly solanum |faitā=Solanum torvum 3.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[solanales]] |familia= [[SOLANACEAE]] |genus=Solanum |species=torvum |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Swartz|Sw.]] |fehokotaki= c }} Ko e '''tisaipale''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia. ʻOku toki ʻomi ki Tongá ni, ʻikai fuoloa. ʻOku ʻikai (teʻeki ai) te ne tupu pē ʻi [[Polinisia]] hahake. Ko hono ʻuhinga tatau: ''Solanum hermanii''.
Ko e ʻakau talatala mo e vaoa taʻefiemaʻu ʻaupito. ʻOku ui ko e ''ʻakau kovi ʻoku mafola mo tupu vao'' ʻe he [[:Category:palemia ʻo Tonga|palemia]] ʻi 1968 (lao fakalahi 1988, vahe 128) maʻa Tonga kotoa pē.
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * lapiti ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * kaisurisuri, kausoni, kauvotovotua, soni ([[lea fakafisi]])
== Tataku == * http://www.hear.org/pier/species/solanum_torvum.htm * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Paingani
Temata
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Tomato |faitā=Tomato scanned.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[solanales]] |familia= [[SOLANACEAE]] |genus=Solanum |species=lycopersicum |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''temata''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia mo e ngaahi foʻi fua lahi mo e manakoa. Ko hono ngaahi ʻuhinga tatau: ''Lycopersicon esculentum'' [[Philip Miller|Mill.]]; ''Lycopersicon lycopersicon'' (L.) [[Gustav Karl Wilhelm Hermann Karsten|H.Karst.]].
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * temata * temata leka; ko e foʻi fua hono lahi ko e senitimita ʻe 2 pe 3, kā ʻoku ʻikai tatau mo e ''Solanum pimpinellifolium'' Jusl. pe ''Lycopersicon pimpinellifolium'', [currant tomato], ko e faʻahinga ʻe taha mei Hauaiʻi (kei siʻi ange tuʻoua)
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * tōmāti ([[lea fakakuki]], [[lea fakatahisi]]) * ʻōhiʻa ma ka nahele ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]], ''S. pimpinellifolium'')
== Tataku == * http://www.hear.org/pier/species/lycopersicon_esculentum.htm * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Pateta
Vaitohi
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Day blooming jessamine |faitā=Cestrum diurnum.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[solanales]] |familia= [[SOLANACEAE]] |genus=Cestrum |species=diurnum |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''vaitohi''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia (mita ʻe 3 pe 4 ʻi ʻolunga) mo e ngaahi matalaʻiʻakau hinehina pea mo e foʻi fua ʻoku ʻuliʻuli. ʻOku lava ʻo fai ha vaitohi mei ai, ʻa ia hono hingoa. Ko e ʻakau ʻomi mei he [[Kalipea]].
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *vaitohi; ʻoku matala he ʻaho, foʻi fua ʻuliʻuli *[[laukaupoʻuli]]; ʻoku matala he pō, foʻi fua hinehina
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *mākāhala ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) *sugi vao, suni vao ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *ariki-vaʻine ([[lea fakakuki]] = ʻeiki-fefine) *caucau ([[lea fakafisi]])
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Laukaupoʻuli
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Night blooming jessamine, Lady of the night |faitā=Cestrum nocturnum, fruit, leaf, flower.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[solanales]] |familia= [[SOLANACEAE]] |genus=Cestrum |species=nocturnum |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} [[File:Cestrum nocturnum, yellowflower.jpg|left|250px|thumb|laukaupoʻuli, motoʻiengeenga]] Ko e '''laukau poʻuli''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia mo e ngaahi matalaʻiʻakau hinehina pea mo e foʻi fua ʻoku hinehina. Taimi ʻe niʻihi ko e matalaʻiʻakau kiʻi engeenga (fakakeheʻi kehekehe?). ʻOku fonu he matalaʻiʻakau ʻi heʻene tangitangi, mo e manongi lahi (lolotonga he pō pe), ko e meʻa fakaʻofoʻofa. Neongo ko e ʻakau fakakona mo e vao ʻaupito. Ko e ʻakau ʻomi mei he [[Kalipea]], ʻoku taʻefuoloa. ʻOku kona ʻa e ʻū foʻi fua.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * [[vaitohi]]; ʻoku matala he ʻaho, foʻi fua ʻuliʻuli * laukaupoʻuli; ʻoku matala he pō, foʻi fua hinehina
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * ʻala aumoe, kūpaoa, onaona Iāpana ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) * (tiare) ariki-vaʻine ([[lea fakakuki]] = ʻeiki-fefine) * kara, caucau, caucau ni bogi ([[lea fakafisi]]) * ike he pō ([[lea fakaniuē]]) * fafine o te pō ([[lea fakatūvalu]]) * teine o le pō, aliʻi o le pō ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]])
== Tataku == * http://www.hear.org/pier/species/cestrum_nocturnum.htm * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Kihikihi (ngeʻesitenga pipiki)
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Spanish clover, Creeping beggarweed |hingoa=Kihikihi |faitā=Desmodium incanum closeup.jpg |faitālaulahi= 320px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[fabales]] |familia= [[FABACEAE]] |genus=Desmodium |species=incanum |fakamoʻoniʻanga= DC. |fehokotaki= c }} Ko e '''kihikihi''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia, ʻoku kihi ia. ʻOku ʻi ai lahi ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe mo e hingoa ʻeni. Ko e '''kihikihí''' ni ʻoku ʻi ai ʻene ngeʻesitenga ʻoku pipiki ʻaupito ki he vala kotoa pē, koeʻuhi ʻa ʻenau ngaahi kiʻi fulufulu.
Ko e kihikihí ni ʻi Tongá ni ʻoku ʻikai ʻi ai hano fulufulu ʻi he kau mo e lou, neongo ʻoku ʻi ai ʻi muli. Ko e faʻahinga kehe ia?
Ko tohi ʻo Yunker ʻoku pehē ko e kihikihi ko e ''D. triflorum'' ia. Mahalo pē naʻe hala ia? Kā ʻoku ʻi ai ʻa e meʻa tatau ʻi [[Fisi]]: ''konikoni''.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *[[kihikihi]]; ko e kihikihi 'moʻoni' *kihikihi, ''D. triflorum'' *kihikihi, koʻeni pe ''D. canum'' (hingoa taʻetotonu) pe ''Hedysarum incanum''; meimei tatau mo e ''D. triflorum'' kā ʻoku siʻi lahi ange, ko e ʻakau ʻomi ki Tonga taʻefuoloa, ʻa ia ʻoku teʻeki ʻi ai hono hingoa fakatonga *[[kihikihitahi]] *[[kihikihimaka]] *kihikihilanumata, ''Galactia tenuiflora'' *[[tamole|kihikihingingie]]
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *piripiri ʻaratita ([[lea fakatahisi]], ''D. incanum'') *kaʻimi ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]], ''D. incanum'') *piripiri, ngātoro ([[lea fakakuki]]) *konikoni, vakacegu ([[lea fakafisi]], ''D. triflorum'')
==Tataku== *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6050 *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/desmodium_incanum.htm *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/desmodium_triflorum.htm *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Kihikihi
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Yellow woodsorrel |faitā=Oxalis corniculata planten.jpg |faitālaulahi= 320px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[oxalidales]] |familia= [[OXALIDACEAE]] |genus=Oxalis |species=corniculata |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= c }} Ko e '''kihikihi''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia, ʻoku kihi ia. ʻOku tupu ʻi he ngaahi fonua kotoa pē ʻo māmani, ʻoku ʻikai ʻiloa naʻe ʻi fē hono feituʻu tupuʻanga.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == *kihikihi; koʻeni *[[kihikihi (ngeʻesitenga pipiki)]] *kihikihilanumata, ''Galactia tenuiflora'' *[[kihikihimaka]] *[[tamole|kihikihingingie]] *[[kihikihitahi]] *[[kihikihipālangi]]
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == *kihikihi ([[lea fakaniuē]]) *patoa ʻavaʻava ([[lea fakatahisi]]) *ʻihi ʻai, ʻihi ʻawa, ʻihi mākole, ʻihi makaʻula ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) *aʻaaʻa, ʻiʻi ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) *kavakava, kōkiʻi, kōkiʻi kura ([[lea fakakuki]]) *matakonikoni, rogomi, totowiwi ([[lea fakafisi]])
== Tataku == *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/oxalis_corniculata.htm *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Fuemoa
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Common morning-glory, Oceanblue morning-glory |faitā=Ipomoea indica4.jpg |faitālaulahi= 280px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[solanales]] |familia= [[CONVOLVULACEAE]] |genus=Ipomoea |species=indica |fakamoʻoniʻanga= (Burm.f.) Merr. |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''fue moa''' pe '''fue pulū''' (ʻoku ʻikai ʻi ai haʻane hingoa fakalakanga ʻi Tongá ni, kā ʻoku ʻi ai ʻi [[Haʻamoa]]) ko e fuʻu ʻakau siʻi mo e totolo ia. ʻOku ui foki ko e ''Ipomoea congesta'' pe ''I. mutabilis'' pe ''I. cathartica'' pe ''I. acuminata'' pe ''I. insularis'' pe ''I. learii''. ʻOku ui foki ko e [[fueʻaepuaka]] ʻe he tokotaha, kā ko e hala ia ?
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== Vakai ki he [[fue]] maʻa e lahi ngaahi fue kehe.
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *fuemoa ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]])
==Tataku== *http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6270 *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Akataha
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= |faitā=Starr_040122-0031_Boerhavia_repens.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[caryophyllales]] |familia= [[NYCTAGINACEAE]] |genus=Boerhavia |species=repens |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= c }} [[File:Starr_050419-0368_Alysicarpus_vaginalis.jpg|left|320px|thumb|akataha hina]] Ko e '''akataha''' ko e hingoa ʻo e ngaahi fuʻu ʻakau siʻi ia. ʻOku ʻi ai honau akatuʻutakele, ko e aka lahi ʻe taha pē. ʻOku meimei tatau ʻenau ʻasi.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * akataha; mahalo pē ko e hingoa hala, vakai ki he [[ʻatono]] * akataha, akataha kula, ''Boerhavia repens''; koʻeni * akataha, akataha kula, ''Boerhavia diffusa'' L., ''B. coccinea'' Mill.; ʻoku pehē ʻe he saienisi ʻe taha ʻoku tatau mo e ''B. repens'' * akataha hina, ''Alysicarpus nummularifolius'' pe ''A. vaginalis'' (L.) DC. (FABACEAE), [buffalo clover, alyce clover] * akataha, aka; tatau mo e [[fueʻaepuaka]]
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * katule ([[lea fakaniuē]]) * alena ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) * ufiʻatuli ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]])
== Tataku == * http://www.hear.org/pier/species/alysicarpus_vaginalis.htm * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler; ISBN 978-0-8248-1528-8 * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Musie
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Bermuda grass, Dog's tooth grass |faitā=Cynodon dactylon.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻitaha]] |ordo= [[poales]] |familia= [[mohuku]] |genus=Cynodon |species=dactylon |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]]) [[Christian Hendrik Persoon|Pers.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''musie''' ko e faʻahinga [[mohuku]] ia, ngāueʻaki maʻa e musie (ko e feituʻu ʻi he ngoue). Kā ʻoku ʻi ai lahi faʻahinga musie kehe maʻa e funga musie.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== *musie liku; vakai ki he [[kefukefu]] *musie matala pulū = [[mohuku vai]] *musie vailima, ''Paspalum conjugatum'' (POACEAE) *musie vai = mohukuʻapōpoa, ''Oplismenus compositus'' (L.) P.Beauv. (POACEAE); ʻoku pehē ʻe ''HEAR'' pē, mahalo pē ko e hala *musie Tonga = [[salapona]] *[[sipilini]]
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== *vaolima ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]], musie vailima)
==Tataku== *http://www.hear.org/pier/species/oplismenus_compositus.htm *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Sipilini
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=St. Augustine grass, Buffalo grass |faitā=Starr_030612-0088_Stenotaphrum_secundatum.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻitaha]] |ordo= [[poales]] |familia= [[mohuku]] |genus=Stenotaphrum |species=secundatum |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Thomas Walter|Walter]]) [[Carl Ernst Otto Kuntze|Kuntze]] |fehokotaki= s }} Ko e '''sipilini''' ko e faʻahinga [[mohuku]] ia, ngāueʻaki maʻa e musie (ko e feituʻu ʻi he ngoue). Ko hono ʻuhinga tatau: ''S. americanum''. ʻOku ʻomi ki Tongá ni taʻefuoloa.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * Vakai ki he [[musie]] maʻa e ngaahi faʻahinga musie kehe. * (ʻikai hano hingoa), ''S. subulatum'' = ''S. micranthum''; tupu pē ʻi he ʻoneʻone ʻo e matātahi pe ofi ki ai; tātātaha
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * mānienie ʻakiʻaki haole, mānienie māhikihiki ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]])
== Tataku == * http://www.hear.org/pier/species/stenotaphrum_secundatum.htm * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler; ISBN 978-0-8248-1528-8 * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Fetonginauna tefitoʻi
page.category: Lea fakatonga
page.text:
Fetonginauna
tefitoʻi		 tuʻuʻanga singulalitualipalulali
fa‘ahi ‘a‘aku
(1 -koe)		 tuʻumuʻau, ou, kumamau
tuʻumuiaukimauakimautolu
fa‘ahi ‘a‘ata
(1 +koe)		 tuʻumuʻatetatau
tuʻumuikitakitauakitautolu
fa‘ahi ‘a‘au
(2)		 tuʻumuʻakemomou
tuʻumuikoekimouakimoutolu
fa‘ahi ‘a‘ana
(3)		 tuʻumuʻanenanau
tuʻumuiiakinauakinautolu
Manatuʻi: *ko e "tuʻuʻanga" ko e "tuʻuʻanga kau ki he [[veape]]" ia, ʻa ia ʻi muʻa pe ʻi mui. Fakatātā: ''ʻOku '''nau''' nofo'' pe ''ʻOku nofo '''kinautolu'''''. *ko e ngaahi fetonginauna tefitoʻi tuʻu ʻi muʻa kātoa ʻoku ngaohi ʻa e [[silapa]] ʻe taha pē (ku, u, ma, te, ta, ke, mo, ne, na), ko e ngaahi [[foʻi lea fiepipiki]] kinautolu. ʻOku ʻikai teitei te nau maʻu ʻa e [[fakamamafa]]. Fakatātā: ''ʻóku nau'' mo e ''ʻokú na'' *ngāueʻaki '''u''' ʻi mui ʻo e ''kuo'', ''te'', ''ne'', pea mo e ''ka'' (hoko ki he ''kau''), ''pea'', ''mo'' mo e ''ʻo''; ngāueʻaki '''ou''' ʻi mui ʻo e ''ʻoku''; pea ngāueʻaki '''ku''' ʻi mui ʻo e ''naʻa''. *ko e ngaahi fetonginauna tefitoʻi tuʻu ʻi muʻa, ko e fetonginauna noa pē, ngāueʻaki he [[supiesi]] pē; pea ko e ngaahi fetonginauna tefitoʻi tuʻu ʻi mui, ko e fetonginauna fakamatemate kapau ngāueʻaki he supiesi, pe ʻoku noa pē kapau ngāueʻaki he [[ʻopiesi]] (tānaki ''kia te''). Fakatātā: ʻOku '''ou''' fehuʻi, ʻOku fehuʻi ʻe '''au''', ʻOku '''ou''' fehuʻi (ʻe) '''au''', ʻOku '''ou''' fehuʻi kia te '''koe''', ʻOku '''ke''' tali kia te '''au'''. Ko e Tonga pē ʻi he ngaahi [[lea fakapolinisia]] ʻoku ʻi ai ʻene ngaahi fetonginauna tefitoʻi tuʻu ʻi muʻa. ʻOku siʻisiʻi ange ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) pe pulia ʻaupito ʻi he ngaahi [[lea fakapolinisia hahake]]. Fakatātā: ʻoku ngāueʻaki ʻa e fetonginauna tefitoʻi tuʻu ʻi mui pē (ʻosi toʻo he ''ki-'') ʻi he [[lea fakatahisi]] ''tē arofa nei mautou iā ʻoutou'': ʻoku ʻofa ʻe kimautolu kia te kimoutolu. [[Category:Lea fakatonga]]

page.title: Kefukefu
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name= Ginger grass, Bird's-beak grass, Kuroiwa grass |faitā=Thuarea involuta kuroiwazasa01.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻitaha]] |ordo= [[poales]] |familia= [[mohuku]] |genus=Thuarea |species=involuta |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Johann Georg Adam Forster|G.Forst.]]) [[Johann Jakob Roemer|Roem.]] & [[Josef August Schultes|Schult.]] |fehokotaki=s }} [[image:Thuarea involuta.jpg|left|320px|thumb|ko e kefukefu ʻi heʻene anga, tupu huli ʻi he funga ʻoneʻone]] Ko e '''kefukefu''' pe '''musie liku''' pe '''mohukuʻapopoa (tahi)''' ko e faʻahinga [[mohuku]] ia, ʻoku ne tupu ʻi he ʻoneʻone ʻo e matātahi. Ko hono ʻuhinga tatau: ''Ischaemum involutum''.
==Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe== * Vakai ki he [[musie]] maʻa e ngaahi faʻahinga musie kehe. * Vakai ki he [[mohukuʻapōpoa]] maʻa e ngaahi faʻahinga mohukuʻapopoa kehe.
==Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe== ʻOku ʻikai hano hingoa makehe ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe, koeʻuhi naʻe ʻikai tuia ʻe he toutai ʻi hē.
==Toe meʻa kehe== He onoʻaho naʻe tui ʻe he kau toutai hanau kahoa mei he kefukefu ʻi muʻa ʻenau fatongia ʻo e ika maʻa honau houʻeiki.
==Tataku== *Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī *Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward *Flowers of the Pacific island seashore; W.A. Whistler; ISBN 978-0-8248-1528-8 *Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Moengālō
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Lemon grass |faitā=YosriNov04Pokok Serai.JPG |faitālaulahi= 240px |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻitaha]] |ordo= [[poales]] |familia= [[mohuku]] |genus=Cymbopogon |species=citratus |fakamoʻoniʻanga= ([[Augustin Pyrame de Candolle|DC.]]) [[Otto Stapf|Stapf]] |fehokotaki= cs }} [[File:Prepared lemon grass.JPG|200px|thumb|left|Ko e mohuku naʻe teuteu maʻa e fai tī]] Ko e '''moengālō''' ko e faʻahinga [[mohuku]] ia, ʻoku tīʻaki.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe ==
* ''Cymbopogon citratus''; koʻeni * (ʻikai hano hingoa), ''Cymbopogon refractus'' (R.Br.) A.Camus, [barbwire grass]; tātātaha ʻi Tongá ni
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * aretu monoʻi, aretu noʻanoʻa ([[lea fakatahisi]], ''C. refractus'') * tī varāni ([[lea fakakuki]]) * moegālō ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * ocagicagi, raba, coyagiyagi ([[lea fakafisi]], ''C. refractus'')
== Tataku == * http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6018 * http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6019 * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}

page.title: Hana
Matapekepeka
Fiki
page.text:
{{Puha fakafaʻahinga |name=Barbados nut, Physic nut |faitā=jatropha curcas5 henning.jpg |regnum= [[ʻakau]] |divisio= [[ʻakau matala]] |classis= [[lautengaʻiua]] |ordo= [[malpighiales]] |familia= [[EUPHORBIACEAE]] |genus=Jatropha |species=curcas |fakamoʻoniʻanga= [[Carolus Linnaeus|L.]] |fehokotaki= cs }} Ko e '''fiki''' ko e fuʻu ʻakau lahi ia (aʻu ki he mita ʻe 6 ʻi olunga). ʻOku meimei tatau ʻene ʻasi mo e fuʻu [[tuitui]], ka ʻoku ʻikai fuopotopoto hano foʻi tenga. ʻE lava fai ʻa e hinu mei ai, neongo ʻoku ʻikai sai maʻa e kai. (Mahalo pē ifo, ka fai lua ([[lea fakapilitānia]]: physic nut, purging nut, ʻa ia hono hingoa ʻe taha: ''Curcas purgans''). ʻOku sai ʻa e hinu maʻa e fai koa pe fai lolo lelemīsini.
== Ngaahi faʻahinga kehekehe == * [[fiki papālangi]] * [[fiki kulamūmū]] * vakai foki ki he [[ʻovava]] mo e [[fiki kai]]
== Hingoa ʻi he ngaahi lea kehe == * kuikui pākē, kukuʻihi ([[lea fakahauaiʻi]]) * lau pata ([[lea fakahaʻamoa]]) * fiki, tuitui pakarangi, tuke, piki ([[lea fakakuki]]) * fiki, maqele, banidakai, wiriwiri ni vavalangi, drala, uto ni vavalangi ([[lea fakafisi]])
== Tataku == * http://www.hear.org/pier/species/jatropha_curcas.htm * http://cookislands.bishopmuseum.org/species.asp?id=6292 * Hokohoko ngaahi ʻakau; Vaʻa fekumi ngoue Vainī * Tongan dictionary; C.M. Churchward * Plants of Tonga; T.G. Yuncker; BPB bulletin '''220''', Honolulu 1959 {{potuʻi}}
